Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: pshah19
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last week and was happy with the good value and service provided by the hotel. The location is about a 5-10 min walk from Palacio Real and very close to Parque Montana and the Egyptian temple. The nearest Metros are Ventura Rodriguez and Plaza Espanya. The hotel had a weekend breakfast special of 13 euros for 2 people so we ended up eating there during our stay. This suited us fine since there are few early morning choices for a continental breakfast in the area and curiously, the kichenette did not have any utensils for cooking unless requested at the front desk. And we did not find the noise from the adjacent school to be a problem since we were not in the room during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to Royal Palace”
Reviews.Author: MariLand
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in the hotel. We enjoyed nice clean room, quiet street, close to the metro 5 minutes walk ( 2 Stations) and a lot of attractions. Free WIFI. There quite a few restaurants and bars in the neighborhood of various food. Spanish, Kebabs, Chinese and etc. The school across the street was closed for easter break. So it was extra quiet. The staff was most helpful. The bathroom was very small, and the fan was working sporadically and would blow the electric fuses. The small fridge was filled with minibar drinks so there was practically no space to store our food and vine. The beds were ok. We did not use the breakfast, but it is available for Euro 12.96 per person. Coffee and Tea E 1.30 extra. Overall I recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Superb service and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: JamieBach
Reviews.Content: I am always a bit sceptical when I read one excellent review after another especially when the rate is reasonable. Well Trip Advisor reviewers did not disappoint. My self and three friends recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. The staff were very helpful and keen to please. We had a junior and a senior suite, both of which were excellent value for money, very clean and very comfortable. Having a kitchen area was a real bonus. Both rooms had a terrace and it was lovely sitting outside with a drink at the end of the day. The hotel is in an excellent position, a 5 minute walk from the Gran Via, really close to the metro but far away enough from the centre so that the local bars are frequented by locals rather than tourists. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Reviewers !”
Reviews.Author: JustininHT
Reviews.Content: Our first quick trip to Madrid and I relied on my fellow TripAdvisor reviewers for our hotel. You guys did well !!! The Hotel Suites Viena was an excellent choice close to the Metro and bus routes and was a very nice place to stay. We decided upon a Junior Suite on the 6th Floor and had a very nice room with a wonderful large terrace. I have to say that the bathroom was much smaller than I expected and could only handle one person at a time. The clearance between the swing of bathroom door and the sink counter was about 1mm ! Staff was super friendly and very helpful. Breakfast buffet was good. The room was very clean and daily maintenance was excellent. Very pleased with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: SaffieSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! After spending some time in some cramped quarters in Barcelona, the Hotel Suites Viena was a fantastic surprise. We booked a junior suite which had a large balcony in addition to a huge sleeping area, (with very comfortable beds!) a small kitchen and a well equipped bathroom. The rooms are very clean and modern as is the common area of the hotel. The shower is great - consistent, good pressure and temperature. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were a little different for the non Spanish palate (I am fairly adventurous with food!), but in addition to the items which seemed unusual, cerals, toast and eggs were also available. Certainly enough to fill up on! The hotel is on the edge of the city center, and is within easy walking distance of the Royal Palace and the Cathedral. If you like to walk, which my husband and I do, the whole city center is accessible from here. There are many "watering points" to break the walk too. If you don't like to walk as much, taxis are everywhere. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellend stay all around.”
Reviews.Author: aolawson
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel in a 1 week trip. This was the cheapest and lowest starred hotel of three different properties where I stayed in Spain and it was the best in location, size, comfort, service, cleanliness, staff, furnishings... I can't stop saying nice things about it. The kitchnette was very convenient, the mini refrigerator extrememly cold. The room was gorgeous and very spacious, the staff were supremely helpful, the maid service top notch, the pillows were plush and comfortable, the complimentary wi-fi was very fast (streaming HD movie fast). I had worries about noise based on other reviews and found this to be a quiet, quiet spot. The areas around the hotel look a bit run-down but they were well lit and I felt very safe at all times. Location is central and has easy access to metro with lots of lines to connect pretty much anywhere in Madrid. Easy to access from the airport with minimal train jumping, and did I say awesome service? Because it was. They were quick to provide maps, recommendations, help with luggage, and a much needed tutorial in how to work the stove after my jetlagged brain couldn't figure it out the whole turn on the breaker and the stove. I shall definitely book this hotel the next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Obligingness and professionalism”
Reviews.Author: Alexander F
Reviews.Content: My wife is fond of cooking, and it is a special pleasure to cook in blessed Spain where we can find the widest range of the freshest vegetables, fruits, seafoods. That’s why we try to find an apartment or a hotel with kitchen in each our trip to Spain. This March, for our short stay in Madrid we chose Sercotel Suites Viena, and we was completely satisfied with it. First of all, many thanks to the hotel staff for their thoroughness - on our arrival we've found in the room all kitchen-ware that we ask in our reservation. In the kitchen there was extremely quick electric oven and moreover – a microwave oven. The bed in our spacious room was enormous (for four people like me, I think) and very comfortable. Concerning the hotel itself, it is conveniently located - near the main sightseeings and the metro station, but in the quiet street, so we had very good sleep. In general, we had enjoyable two days in Madrid. Check-in, early in the Saturday morning, took only a couple of minutes – a pleasant young man at the reception acted quickly, efficiently and attentively. We would undoubtedly recommend this hotel. The only weakness is too small bathroom; it can be larger especially given that the room itself is huge. But it is the compliant against a constructor, not against the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: ALfromBoston
Reviews.Content: The price for a studio in January was an incredible bargain. The place was spotless and relatively modern and the kitchenette was perfect. Wireless internet was included in the price and worked flawlessly. The staff were very pleasant and the maids did a great job. The location is perfect, a very quiet street a few blocks from Plaza de Espana, on the other side of which is the Gran Via. There is a supermarket a few blocks away and a number of restaurants, movie theaters, etc. The hop-on, hop-off bus stops a few blocks away and it's well worth buying a one or two day pass because it will take you to all the major attractions, including the Prado and the Reina Sofia Museum, which has Picasso's Guernica.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CaroleandPhil
Reviews.Content: Lovely, clean, comfortable hotel with bright, modern suites and friendly and helpful staff - special thanks to Katy who kept our room spotless! Slightly removed from the main tourist areas but the proximity to the superb Temple of Debod (a Nubian temple dating from 200BC) in the nearby park more than compensates - don't miss it. The Cafe Viena just up the road is a friendly watering hole serving excellent tapas and loved being woken by Boccherini's Minuet playing from the school opposite!

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: awhitecotton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend in March. A couple of blocks away from Plaza de Espana, the metro line there will links you up to nearly anywhere you'd want to go fairly quickly. Rooms were spacious for Europe, very clean and very modern. Breakfast is now 13 euros for two people. Quiet street, kind of off of the main drags which is really nice. Nothing bad at all to say, it's a great place to stay. I'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka_11
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location, very clean and with really comfortable beds. However, we were woken up by street noise few times during our stay. Also, the kitchenette had no cutlery, plates or pots, it wasn't an issue for us but if you are planning on cooking something that would be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: vanguar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and aesthetically pleasing. The room I stayed at had a very clean modern look and feel. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had a couple of seats making somewhat of a living room, plus a table and chair. It had a kitchen, which I never used, but was extreemly clean as well. The bathroom is a bit tight, but cleaness is the first impression. As drawbacks I would say, that since there is no place to put one's luggage, the room doesn't look as neet once one is established in it. Also, it is close to eveything, but it is not that close. The nearest metro satation is a 10 min walk away. There are other places one can stay at for a little less, that are in the middle of things. I stayed later at a hostal in la Latina, and I missed the comfort of Hotel Suites Viena, but not the location. I felt hotel Viena itself was very quiet, but every night, noise would come up from the street below, one night there was even a scuffle between two drunk kids outside, which fortunately was of no consequence, but the noise did reach up to the 5th floor. I think the area is pretty safe, looking down at night I could see poeple walking alone, women even, at 2 or 3 in the morning. If you are travelling with your couple, want refuge from the noise and value neatness, this is a great place to stay. If you are travelling alone or with some friends, and are young and wrestless, there are other places more suitable, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “SV nailed it again”
Reviews.Author: psgeorockclimber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again and they keep getting better. The hotel is one block away from Temple de Dabol and two from Plaza Espanza. Metro are a few blocks away and down hill from the Ventura Rodiguez stop. SV continues to maintain very clean and modern rooms (stay on the back due to street and school noise in the front rooms) that have plenty of choices for very quiet rooms. We actually booked the breakfast special (2 for 13 euros) because they have finally improved the breakfast. The wonderful cafe a few doors up the street and on the corner is outstanding and there are numerous restaurants and a few good grocery markets (DIA) very close by. Depending on the metro stop you use, the hotel is two or three lines from MAD airport. The real benefit of the SV is the exceptional staff (Laura provided off the chart service and recommendations) and they will answer almost all question (excluding the lotto number for that night's upcoming drawing) and there were plenty asked everytime I am there. This is an excellent location for running (any season of the year) parks or the historical sights. There are also several Catholic Churches within 7-8 blocks with Saturday evening masses starting from 18:00, 17:00, and 20:00. Get on the hotel owner's specials email list for some excellent deals.

Reviews.Title: “nearly faultless...”
Reviews.Author: Raul N
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay, great central location. Clean, trendy and modern facilities. Staff were professional, helpful, spoke decent English and very knowledgeable. There are loads of takeaway food, fast-food restaurant and supermarket options locally. The kitchenette area proved to be very handy.The breakfast was very good and provided by an artisan patisserie which is 2 minutes walk away. There is a free internet PC in the lobby but be warned the Wifi is not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Limited facilities but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: StuartAinsworth
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel when travelling on business. Clean and well finished with excellent staff. My only gripe as a business traveller is that there are no irons in the hotel at all. A laudry service exists but thats no good for a late night freshen up! No restuarant for evening meals but room service or tanle service is available at a nearby location. Breakfast is however pletniful and varied an excellent start to the day. The hotel is only 10 minutes walk to the main heart of Madrid and well served by buses and the extensive and cheap Metro. I prefer to use this hotel despite its few shortcomings as it is clean and excellent value. On this trip the hotel lost all hot water in the morning. Staff worked hard but were iunsuccessful in repairing before I checked out. No charge for my stay at all - thats customer focus, no quibbles no arguements - well done all round

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: AussieLondon362
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a wide variety of hotels during our Andalucia trip (from B&Bs to 5 star) and this is one of our favourites because it offered such good value for money (Madrid hotels in a good location are not cheap). It isn't a huge hotel with hundreds of rooms so it felt a bit more intimate even though the interior feels modern and clean. These are all the main positives about the hotel: - Location. Close to 2 metros, Plaza de Espana, Gran Via, Palace (all within a 5 - 10 minute walk). The street is also relatively quiet so we had a peaceful night's sleep. - Staff. All very friendly and helpful. Service with a smile :-) - Rooms. Free wifi, clean, large, had a kitchenette and eating area so we could prepare our own food - Room service. As it's a smaller hotel it doesn't have a massive kitchen so they outsource their room service to 2 local restaurants. Great idea! You pay the price of a delivery. You can have something from a German/Viennese style restaurant or a sushi restaurant. Not Spanish but after 2 weeks of non stop Spanish, I was gagging for sushi! - Breakfast. I didn't try this but the other half did and whilst the selection was smaller than in larger business hotels he said the quality was so much better and there were little sandwiches which mixed it up a little. I thoroughly recommend this hotel. It doesn't sell itself as a luxury hotel so I'm not saying it is, but the rooms are clean, large and modern so I felt very comfortable and I enjoyed it as much I did when I stayed in other hotels with 4 or 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AdvoKitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011 and would probably stay again. The rooms were nice and modern, although the wi-fi connection was quite poor in our room but there was a computer available in the lobby if necessary. The receptionists spoke good English and the hotel was reasonably close to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Time To Madrid”
Reviews.Author: 1Rob1
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel in its' well-aged neighborhood may be a bit of a challenge to find on foot at first ( no huge neon sign ) but a walk in the area is well worth the adventure. Attractive hotel staff were very informative and friendly. After a long day of walking, our room was perfect. Like Barcelona, Madrid rewards lots of walking and meandering. We highly recommend the Metro, a neighborhood bistro serving delicious dinners to unassuming diners - delightfully laid-back. The Prado is a long leisurely walk away. We very much look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: WKK10
Reviews.Content: 5 minute walk from Plaza de Espana metro stop, free internet, nice room... zero issues. I'd stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bankergirl1016
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms, very new, great service - though I paid a bit more than my budget. Very conveniently located near Plaza de Espana metro station. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and modern.”
Reviews.Author: IMHO5555
Reviews.Content: Service was helpful. Rooms were modern and clean. The shower was warm and had decent pressure. The beds were comfortable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Catboom
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean and what can we say? It was impossible to adjust the temperature. It was not the most friendly place, and the wi-fi was non existant. Although it was supposed to be. If we had it to do again, We'd skip Madrid & go straight to Sevilla.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MozzaAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything and very quiet. There is no crockery or cutlery when you arrive but they quickly stock your unit. The reception is very friendly. There is free wi fi and also a free computer to use in the lobby. There is a supermaket in 5 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, large, comfortable rooms. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Canuck0420
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 3 nights there. I see the other reviews critical of the location but I guess it depends on what is important to you. We like to walk and we found that the La Latina area, an old part of Madrid with narrow cobblestone streets and many Tapas bars, was about a 15 minute walk. You can't get much better than that. We walked to the Prado in about 25 minutes. Mercado San Miguel (highly recommended) was about a 10 minute walk. The staff were great. The breakfast OK. We did not have breakfast included in the room and each morning they offered it to us for 6 Euros (half price). We had a rental car and parked in the underground garage (22 Euros per day).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: viaggiaxpiacere
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and very well located. It is very close to the gran via and the royal palace. Since we were 3, we had the suite in the 5th floor which, actually, it is not so different from the regular rooms. The rooms are big and clean and the service is ok. Concierges are very helpful and frendly. breakfast not included and a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked in a Lane.”
Reviews.Author: seawaves
Reviews.Content: The good thing about the hotel pehaps is its staff. The rooms are standard and the bathrooms are small. You cannot call the kitchen and kitchen. The hotel is located in a narrow lane and hence is blocked for any view, whatsoever. The Breakfast at Euro 12 may best be skipped. Internet is good and Free. The location is ok, given that it is close to Plaza Espana and Temple of Debod . At a certain price, the hotel is good value for money. Booking in advance gives a very good price. At the end, one finds, Madrid is a city of Hostels and the Hostels are more well located then most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to many sights”
Reviews.Author: Missriverview
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel. Quiet if on the courtyard side. Bathroom a bit tight and whoever put the bathroom door stop on the floor in front of the toilet ought to receive a sound beathing! Can't tell you how many times we stubbed out toes! Many sights an easy walk and others such as the Prado will be doable if you don't mind a good hike. A small grocery within a block if you want to pick up some snacks or self cater. A few restaurants close by, our favorite was Da Cuchuffo just up the street. Front deck staff friendly, but no overly helpful. Did not try the breakfast buffet as too pricey for us. Appreciated the free computer access. Overall, a good value and location OK if you like to walk. A big plus was the Bravo Bike office right next to the hotel! Check out their Madrid bike tour!

Reviews.Title: “WAS PERFECT FOR ME”
Reviews.Author: Coeury
Reviews.Content: Good Location. Helpful Staff. Excellent Quality price. Good room size, Modern and clean. Will go again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Joycerny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is no more than a 5 minute walk to the Plaza Espana metro stop. The room is very large by European city standards, though the bathroom layout made it cramped for 2 people to maneuver. There are kitchen facilities but absolutely nothing to cook with or eat on. Our room was on the street side, 2nd floor, and we were awakened all night by noises from the street. Windows were closed, but sounded as if they were open. The staff, which was very helpful, moved us to a courtyard side room for the remaining nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel and reasonable room.”
Reviews.Author: 29AJW
Reviews.Content: Hotel Suites Viena is a good hotel, got it for a reasonable price. It was in a good (not perfect) location, but since the Madrid metro is so easy to use, you can get to any destination reasonably well. Internet was down in the lobby and a television was included in the room. Bathroom was in good condition as well. We did notice that in the beds there were some black hairs in them, so the maid may have left her hair in it while she was cleaning. The staff at reception were alright, but not particuarly friendly. Overall, a good value hotel with a reasonable room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before heading to Italy. Very nice size room, comfy bed and very clean. The location is fantastic. We rode the Metro and walked everywhere. The breakfast was great! Everyone was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great value & Location”
Reviews.Author: Stacie B
Reviews.Content: We booked our flight and hotel together via Travelocity.com and this hotel was great! It was priced right, in a great location, only a 5-minute walk to the Plaza de Espana metro stop. Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and spoke English if we asked. They even offered to make a flamenco show reservation for us when we asked where the best place was to go. The rooms were very clean and made daily. The beds were OK but everything else made up for a mediocre bed. Definitely recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern base to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: nbdoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a brand new building inserted into the busy neighborhood bordering C/Princessa and Plaza de Espana. The school across the street did not bother us at all. It is few minutes away from 2 subway stations, 10 min. walk from Royal Palace, and there are plenty of places to eat around it. The hotel has a garage, which is a great plus in that area. Wi-fi in the room, PC with the printer in the lobby. The rooms are very clean and modern, but even for that they seemed to be lacking in terms of decor - the walls in the room seemed bare. The bathroom is modern and adequate. Stuff is very helpful, and we enjoyed the places to eat that they recommended.The breakfast was priced at outrageous E12 (both when we booked and when we checked in), so we did not book it, but instead went to the cafe called Viena Capellanes, which actually provides breakfast and room service to this hotel. There you can have a very nice breakfast for much less. We were forced to have a breakfast at the hotel the last day, because we had to leave early, and to our surprise it was offered to us for E6 ("we are running special"). For that amount it is certainly a great value, but why did not they tell us that 2 days previously? Overall, very nice place to stay in Madrid, would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and good location”
Reviews.Author: JassyDigla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Suites Viena for 3 nights. It was spotlessly clean and seemed newly renovated. Its situated 5-10 minutes walk from the palace in a small quiet street. But be aware that youths of Madrid sit around in the streets drinking and talking so in the weekends it can be a little bit noisy from these groups if tour room is faceing the street and you leave the window open. Can recommend this hotel to other travelers. Only negative thing to say was when I asked for restuarant recommandation I was reccomended the hotels own Viena Cafe. Not quite what I was looking for. Free wifi, safe, fridge, cookingplates and tv in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for very reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: MarySP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year, and chose it based on the reviews I read in TripAdvisor. I was not disappointed, the hotel was very nice, rooms were great and location was excellent, about 2 blocks away from subway station. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice base in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodDuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife a couple weeks ago. The room and bed were very nicely sized for a European hotel. The staff were friendly and spoke English well. We had an excellent housekeeper as well. The location is a little bit out of the way but being next to the metro makes everything easily accessible. My only complaint is that the bathroom was small, but it is a very minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “So good, up until...”
Reviews.Author: Spanisheyes00
Reviews.Content: Started a 10 day trip through Spain with my Mom in early September. Our first stop was Madrid and based on the glowing reviews I booked 2 nights here. Check in was easy and the room was modern and clean. The bathroom was tight, but having traveled through Europe before I was half expecting this. No big deal though. The hotel is really close to Templo Deblod and Plaza Espanya. Its also close to the Palacio Real. For the most part, my mom and I walked everywhere, even walked all the way to Parque de Retiro. We chose to have breakfast at the hotel one morning as they were running a special - breakfast for 2 for 13 Euros. The breakfast was adequate with some small ham and cheese sandwiches, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, french toast and an assortment of pastries and juices as well as coffee. I thought it was pretty good. I was super happy with the choice of hotel up until our first evening. Our room faced the street and we were up 3 floors. I was woken up at about 2 am with loads of screaming drunken people on the street. Even with the windows completely closed, it wouldn't have made any difference if the windows were open, it was that loud. Now, I can't blame the hotel for people deciding to scream at the top of their lungs, but perhaps do something to soundproof the windows a little bit. And then here's where it goes downhill...we were a little chilly so I pulled the blanket out of the closet. As I was falling asleep my mom mentioned an ant on the cover. I was 1/2 asleep and didn't think much of it. Well, I wake up and while my mom is showering, I'm sitting up and looking down - it was no ant. It was a bedbug. I immediately threw the blanket off and threw it back in the closet. Took a hot shower and put everything that we had been wearing in a plastic bag and tied it, then put it in another plastic bag. I contacted the woman at the front desk and you could tell she was super apologetic. I told them to change all the sheets/towels and remove the blanket. Later that afternoon when we returned, I closely examined the bed and found nothing. Although the situation could have been worse, I was left with this lingering worry throughout the rest of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: PJZ300
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located from my perspective. It is about a 20 minute walk down the Grand Via to the Puerta del Sol, which is great so you are not smack dab in the middle of all of the partying. However, there are some bars in the neighborhood and there can be some street noise at 2 a.m. Best suggestion is either earplugs or request a room in the back of the hotel. The mattresses were firm and extremly comfortable. The sheets were always crisp and clean. The towels were perfect! There are loads of TV stations for when you chilling in the room prior to going to sleep, but all of the English channels are of news programs. If you head down to the Temple Debod and hang a right, there are about 5 or 6 restaurants, including an Irish pub, in the area. It is easily accessible to the "riverwalk" for runners! It was a short distance to pretty much all tourist stops. Make sure you do the Red Tourist Bus ride. It really helps with getting your bearings in the city. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. I never had a problem communicating. They always came through with wake up calls. Free internet in the lobby, but the computer is a tad slow. Did not eat the breakfast there. I ended up walking to Starbucks just a few blocks away. Make sure you stop at the department store as they have a grocery in the lower level and stock up on some basic snacks for your room.

Reviews.Title: “good accomodation, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Mancs12
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly. Spacious and very clean rooms. The rooms do not come equipped with any kitchen equipment. If you want anything its a matter of asking at reception for everything. Its hard to be negative about Suites Viena but on the negative side it is a llittle far from the major attractions. Its not the nicest area I have stayed in but it was safe and quiet. I would prefer to be closer to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SenorCancun
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Suites Viena and we stayed for 6 days. Given the great reviews on TripAdvisor I came with high expectations. I had previously stayed at the Hotel Mercure Plaza Espana (which is a few blocks away) and at the Melia Fenix. Location: The hotel is about 3 blocks away from Plaza Espana. We easily walked to the Sol and the Cibella and the Del Prado. We think it is a great location to base yourself and see Madrid. Breakfast: We ate the buffet breakfast at the hotel only once. There is plenty to choose from though the quality and freshness is a bit underwhelming. The Cuban lady that serves breakfast is chock full of information (i.e. if you speak Spanish). We also found a nearby restaurant named Cascaras which serves breakfast Madrid style -- we loved the whole-wheat croissants (croissants integral, in local vernacular). Rooms: Rooms were nice but sterile. A small kitchen comes with it but the refrigerator is full of mini-bar items so you can't really use it too much. If you plan to use the cooktop or microwave you have to ask the front desk for utensils. Room did not have a coffee-maker but you can go to the lounge and get some for 1.60 Euros. The king-size bed is actually two twin beds attached side-by-side. We got a small to moderate amount of street noise. Service: No problems with service. All request were attended to with precision. Our room was serviced by "Nora" and she just did a wonderful job everyday in putting some order to the mess we created. Frills: Wi-fi service was free and reasonably fast. There are internet accessible computers and printers in the lobby. Overall: I was satisfied but not wowed. Would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Partygal84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in September. The hotel is very clean, as are the rooms. The room we had was a triple room and although on the small side, it had everything we needed for a city break including a kitchenette. We never actually used the kitchenette as there are restaurants serving good food nearby. We tended to eat whilst out during the day and then come back closer to the hotel in the evening for drinks and snack type food. Daniel on reception was most helpful to any query we had during our stay. He provided us with good places to eat, directions to El Rasta and booked our return taxi to the airport for us. The hotel is close to Temple Debod and Plaze De Espana, also not far walking distance to the Cathedral and the Royal Palace. Madrid has lots of tourist attractions and good shops for those wanting to go on a little spree (as I did!!) I was impressed by the city and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel in a good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: JennyC30
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group of friends. We all thought the hotel was really good value and although all of our rooms slightly varied in size they were all clean and modern and had everything that we needed. The bathroom was modern and the shower was really hot and powerful. We weren't in the hotel much and didn't have breakfast there so I can't comment on that but the staff were friendly and helpful when we did need anything. We didn't use the kitchen but the fridge was good for keeping drinks cool.The area around the hotel is quiet but it is only a 5 minute walk to the metro. We tended to walk into the centre as it wasn't too far. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BelKe
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant, front desk was very friendly and did a good job. Room was spacious and well equipped. Some minor spots were not cleaned well, and the fridge quit working after 1 night, but all in all worth the money. The only negative point was the poor and unfriendly service at breakfast. She was constantly using her cell phone and not helpful or friendly. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Spencers836
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through friends. It is just amazing. The rates are excellent. The suite we stayed in had a beautiful balcony with lounge chairs, a spacious sleeping area, and a small kitchenette with a refrigerator, stove and micro. The hotel is quiet. It's on a sidestreet just off of a major avenue. It's located centrally, so that you can walk everywhere in historic Madrid, as well as in the park nearby, and you can access great shopping. The staff speaks English, and all of them reached out to help us with whatever questions we had -- big or small. The breakfast bar (although it seems high priced by some American standards) was an absolute bargain by Madrid standards. The food was elegant, fresh and delicious. The coffee is brewed fresh. Plenty of fresh fruit and many choices. The hotel is in a 'real' neighborhood -- everything you might need is within a short walking distance. There is wi-fi that works easily and quickly. We can't say enough about this hotel. It's a bargain; it's elegant; it was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN, MODERN HOTEL. (PERFECT)”
Reviews.Author: lydulee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner in July 2011. It is spotless, beds were huge, modern fittings in every room, mini bar was always stocked up, and there was a couple of room service menus in the room. I reccomend the noodle bar menu, we had some lovely food from there! The people on the desk were very helpful and gave us maps to find certain places. If you are looking for a hotel with entertainment and a bar this is not the one for you! This hotel is perfect if you have children or are looking for a relaxing break or a sight seeing break. PLEASE TRY TO USE THE METRO WHEN YOUR THERE AS WE GOT RIPPED OFF IN A TAXI FROM THE AIRPORT. THEY CHARGED US 35 EUROS! YOU CAN GET THE METRO RIGHT INTO THE AIRPORT FOR 1 EURO EACH.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: westli
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is away from the centre of the action it is easy to access from Metro station Plaza Espana, just walk across park and turn right up Juan Alvarez Mendizabel . Clean spacious room with cooking facilities (you must ask at reception for any utensils!) but TINY bathroom that only holds one person at a pinch. Previous reviews mentioned the noise from the school over the road, but our room was at the back of the hotel and very quiet. Walk a few paces up the street to Cafe Viena for breakfast, used by locals and great food. There is only a five minute walk to Palacio Real and Gran Via or a 10 to 15 minute walk to Plaza Mayor. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but don't trust the wi-fi.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainStu7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed here for 3 nights and as the title suggests the only problem we can think of is that the wireless didn't work but there is a free PC in the lobby. The location is handy but not glamorous but the room was great and very clean, staff were very helpful, close to the metrolink and several restaurants but one thing to note - the kitchenette doesn't come with any crockery or cutlery but you can get this from reception by simply asking. Would definitely recommend this hotel and it gives great service with value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Somewherenew08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and the hotel certainly exceeded our expectations. Good sized smart rooms, spotlessly clean with good aircon, minibar, small kitchenette, safe and reliable wifi. Located just a couple of minutes walk from Plaza Espania, and convenient for exploring central Madrid on foot the hotel location was excellent. Taxi from airport was pretty quick and cost around €30. Staff were also very helpful and spoke good English. Would be more than happy to stay here again and found the hotel to offer excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Madrid”
Reviews.Author: vinmaz44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and I would recommend the location. It was very central to 2 train stations and there were quite a few restaurants within walking distance. The room was very clean but the bathroom was unbelivably tiny so let the place down. Breakfast was included and was ok. Reception staff were friendly and helpful especially the girl who was on nights. Cannot remember her name, she was only tiny with dark very short cropped hair. She was absolutely delightful and could not do enough to help you. She deserves more than a pat on the back from management. If you want a cheap place to stay in a good location and don't mind a micro mini bathroom then this place would be ok for you.

Reviews.Title: “No need to look further”
Reviews.Author: WHCTTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that is well located, reasonably priced, spotless clean, quiet and air conditioned, this is the place. We stayed here for 2 nights with our adult sons and were absolutely thrilled with everything. We did take advantage of the breakfast deal which allowed 2 people to eat for the price of 1 and thought that it was excellent. The staff was nice but one staff member in particular stood out-Alex. He was extremely helpful! We asked him tons of questions about activities, restaurants, etc. and his advice was fantastic. We were sad to say good-bye at the end of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: VanessaMunYee
Reviews.Content: We had to take a cab from Madrid train station to Suite Viena because it is quite a distance. This hotel is closer to Plaza de Espana. – took about 10minutes walk, which is also where the tourist bus stop were. It is also a short walk to the shops by Grand Via the main street! The hotel has a huge lobby and waiting area. There is a computer by the lobby for guest use and the wifi service is free. Service from the reception staff was good; he gave us enough information about the area. I love the room – it was huge! Working desk with 2 chairs, flat screen TV and the one I love was the kitchenette! Complete with a microwave and electrical stove! Although we did not use them but you can imagine how big the room was. And Of cause the room was clean. Our queen bed was clean and comfortable. There was also a coffee table with 2 sofas! The bathroom was clean and big with a bath tub and the amenities were more then enough. There were variety of choices at the buffet breakfast and it was fantastic! Considering the price we paid, is definitely worth the value and we will definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room with low price”
Reviews.Author: VanessaMunYee
Reviews.Content: We had to take a cab from Madrid train station to Suite Viena because it is quite a distance. This hotel is closer to Plaza de Espana. – took about 10minutes walk, which is also where the tourist bus stop were. It is also a short walk to the shops by Grand Via the main street. This hotel is located on a slope – it was quite a walk when you need to walk up that slope with bags! The hotel has a huge lobby and waiting area. There is a computer by the lobby for guest use and the wifi service is free. Service from the reception staff was good; he gave us enough information about the area. I love the room – it was huge! Working desk with 2 chairs, flat screen TV and the one I love was the kitchenette! Complete with a microwave and electrical stove! Although we did not use them but you can imagine how big the room was. And Of cause the room was clean. Our queen bed was clean and comfortable. There was also a coffee table with 2 sofas! The bathroom was clean and big with a bath tub and the amenities were more then enough. There were variety of choices at the buffet breakfast and it was fantastic! Considering the price we paid, is definitely worth the value and we will definitely go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: jsp1000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic,spotlessly clean,Modern apartments in a Brilliant Location.. The hotel is a couple of minutes from Plaza Espana which is easily got to by Tube from the Airport in around Half Hour. The surrounding Streets are Clean and Quiet and filled with Great Tapas Bars,most sites are Walkable and the Royal palace is just a 10 minute stroll,also a Great Spot for The Bernabeau which is 5 stops direct from Plaza Espana Metro.. Staff are very Friendly and speak Great English,would never stay anywhere else and can't wait to go back !!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Basic”
Reviews.Author: TripaholicHongKong
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room after our long fly and the staff there did that absolutely right. They got us a very quiet room and we had very good sleep throughout our two-night stay there. What I like most is the minimal design here. Room is clean. Breakfast is local and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Found a winner!”
Reviews.Author: bellamia88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 9 days in Madrid and absolutely loved it! Great price too. Very pleasant and helpful staff all spoke great English. Hotel was very clean and put together. Free wifi although it was very slow at times and they also had a computer with free internet in the lobby. I did have one minor problem the ceiling in my bathroom started leaking at one point because it was raining a lot however I got accomodated with free breakfast the next morning and I didn't even ask. I was on my way out to get my day started and the guy at the front desk pulled me aside and told me to have a seat because today I get free breakfast I had no idea how they even knew I was the one having a problem with my room. The breakfast was wonderful they had a variety of fresh foods but it's on the pricey side 12 euros so unless you're that hungry to wait to go somewhere else then I personally wouldn't recommend as the hotel is surrounded by several cafes and resturaunts. The hotel is in a great location less than a 5 minute walk from 5 different metro stations and only 10 minutes away from the Royal Palace and just 5 mins to hit Gran Via. The only thing is the suite does not provide any dishes or utensils you have to go down and ask the person working up front to obtain it, same goes for dish soap and supplies to wash the dishes need to be purchased. Otherwise I will definately be staying here again when I go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: winifredScotland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be a very good choice, thanks to the reviews on TA. The hotel is situated in a nice quiet street but there are plenty of cafes and eating places nearby, a good place for breakfast is cafe Viena just up from the hotel, freshly squeezed oj and delicious toastades y tomate, tthey also do pastries. The hotel is close to Plaza Espana and a fairly short walk to the busy gran Via. It is also close to the metro. The hotel is very modern clean and comfortable, it also has a small modern kitchen area with microwave which was handy for drinks after a long day sightseeing. We have visited many countries and I can be very fussy but when I return to Madrid I will definitely book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't recommend a better hotel in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Sun42Devil
Reviews.Content: I am a U.S. resident who travels to Madrid quite frequently on business. As such, I have stayed in several different "luxury" hotels all on the company expense. Unfortunately, my wife has never been able to come with me on any of my travels, so we decided to have a little holiday in Madrid. Because my company was not picking up the tab for this trip, I needed to find a hotel which was comfortable, clean and provided the best value for the money. The later being very important since the U.S. dollar is currently so weak compared to the Euro. I did a lot of research trying to find the perfect hotel for my trip. I read many reviews right here on tripadvisor and decided to give Hotel Suites Viena a try. I was not disappointed in the least. The hotel is situated a few hundred meters from two different metro stations - Plaza de Espana or Ventura Rodriguez. Each only a few minutes walk. Additionally, the hotel is within a very quiet neighborhood but close to a variety of eating establishments and even a Starbucks for those who need that morning cup of coffee. Upon check in, I found the staff to be extremely helpful and kind. As a non-Spanish speaking person, I found the staff's command of the English to be flawless. The rooms are simplistic and modern. To be honest, the one I stayed in was the largest and most comfortable room I have been in yet during any of my trips to Madrid. This includes 5-Star hotels such as the Miguel Angel! My room included a small strove top, microwave and sink if I ever felt the need to use them (I did not). Wireless internet was also available for free within my room as well. Again, something I have not had in any other hotel in Madrid! The bottom line is this, I cannot recommend any hight the Hotel Suites Viena! From now on, I will be staying here for all my trips to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: beckyb78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May and was very pleased with the location (only 5mins walk to the palace and old town), room (was clean and air con worked well), staff (they were friendly and helpful). If I go to Madrid again I will definitely stay here. Only negative: please please have your wits about you on the metro and in public places. Pickpocketing is rife and they have clever ways of working so keep valuables close and don't put anything in your backpockets!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Nimu
Reviews.Content: The positives - My husband and I were passing through Madrid for 3 nights and this was actually good value for money for a 3 star hotel. The rooms are quite spacious and hav a kitchenette (no cutlery, crockery or kettle but have a microwave if you need to warm anything). We found the staff to be helpful with information and check in. We also had an opportunity to get breakfast at half price which was great and saved us having to go out looking for the breakfast - which was really nice consisting of a full spread. The internet connection was reliable. The Metro was was also quite close-by and it as very easy to get around with the main tour bus literally passing just outside the hotel which was great. The noise level was also alright but if you are really adverse to noise please ask for a room away from the school close by. It did not particularly bother me but I could see how it might for some. The negatives - The bathroom is rather cramped and some of the bathroom amenities were not replaced like the shower cap and the soap in the dispenser. The double bed was two beds put together with separate beddings it was quit uncomfortable. Generally good value for money and would recommend it for a clean no frills trip.

Reviews.Title: “good one-but need some repair”
Reviews.Author: muratozdemir
Reviews.Content: first of all the location was great. it is just near the plaza de espana and 200 mt to metro station. staff was doing their best too. But the rooms are in need of some repair. lock of bathroom was broken. And more important; altough we indiacate that we prefer smoking room during the booking (and that was 6 months ago) they want extra 116 eur p/p at the check-in!.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo”
Reviews.Author: Charlielin
Reviews.Content: Good location - walking distance to Royal Palace and Opera. Good value to money - spacious room with kitchenette, living area - made yourself at home. Reasonable price for breakfast - less than Euro 7- you can enjoy your full breakfast. Facing the school, it's so quiet that we got sound sleep. Remember to try "Da'Cuchuffo Madrid " 2 mins away, the steak is yummy with delicious dessert - Rank no. 2 in tripadvisor's restaurant. Hotel Viena Suites is the Best Value Hotel for our Spanish Trip in 12 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great !”
Reviews.Author: kalevet
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in the heart of Madrid. Located a few minutes away from Plaza de Espana and Gran Via - this hotel is perfect for a city break. Large clean rooms with a TV, desk, chairs, large wardrobe, extra blankets, good AC, shower/bath with good pressured water, towels changed everyday, free WIFI, free toiletries etc - and it doesn't cost too much either. A great deal with amazing value. Reception were friendly especially the female receptionist whose name I've forgotten. Very helpful and informative. Only negative was that cutlery wasn't readily available in the room you had to ask the reception for what you wanted. However, we ate out every night so it didn't effect us per say. Also, the comments about the noise are exaggerated. We stayed in a room facing the school/road and could hardly hear anything. The windows are sound proof. Definitely would visit again !

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: gzysuperstar
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. It was clean, the free wifi worked great, the breakfast offer was a great buy and delicious. The rooms were very spacious for an affordable European hotel. Ours included a kitchenette, desk and sitting area. We had a lot of noise from the street (locals chatting VERY loud) and you can hear very easily through the walls... either way, the rooms were nice, the staff was fantastic and for the price, it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tracymcgreevy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel at the end of April for 4 nights and we highly recommend it. It is very central to most things in Madrid & for things that are further afield, there are several metro stations near by. We took the Metro from the airport to Plaza De Espana and the hotel was about 5 mins walk from there. The rooms were clean, spacious and very well kept. The staff were very helpful, especially a female receptionist (sorry I forgot your name) who helped us to order Sushi to our room after a long day walking about Madrid as our Spanish wasn't up to scratch. Thank you again for that. The hotel is near a school and you do hear the children in the morning but that is to be expected, other than that there were no noise complaints. Fantastic Hotel, would return again if we ever come back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Malsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night and was pleased with the overall experience. The lobby was bright and contemporary with helpful staff. The hotel is situated in a quietish street opposite a school. There was some noise in the early hours which seemed to be the refuse collectors but nothing too intrusive.The room was a good size with a massive bed and although the bathroom was a little cramped it was well appointed and the shower was very good. Mini kitchen in the room including fridge and microwave. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel but the Vienna Cafe (out of hotel turn left about 100 meters away) was very good value. Hotel is a 5 minute walk from Plaza Espana metro station and about a 10 minute walk from Palacio Real.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RateMyHoliday
Reviews.Content: This aparthotel is simple, smart and minimal. The room was clean and quiet and the hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever!!”
Reviews.Author: faraway46
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, huge kitchen, large bathroom, modern decor, comfortable beds, great breakfast, outstanding location (5min walk to Plaza España, 10min to Palacio Real, 5min to metro). Staff is attentive and warm, very helpful. Great shower/tub with endless hot water, large towels replaced daily, super complete bath amenities and room extremely clean. Great closet with many (did I say many?) hangers. I can't say enough about this hotel. I would vote it for best value for service in Madrid! I have read that it was noisy because of the school that is directly in front, but during our 3 day stay (weekday) we never heard a peep, although we did have a back room, not facing the street...). Just in case I would recommend a back room, but once again, during our entire stay the whole hotel was super quiet. Surely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: talleeeyah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights and found it comfortable, clean, and well-situated in the city. The location is a 5 minute walk from Plaza de Espana and close to several Metro stations that can take you anywhere you want to go. You are also within short walking distance of the Royal Palace and the Templo Debod (Egyptian Temple and a beautiful park). There is also a free computer station with internet access in the lobby, which is a nice feature. The rooms themselves are apartment-style with mini kitchens, which is a nice feature. We did not do breakfast in the hotel because it was totally overpriced and we enjoyed visiting the local cafes and bakeries. On the downside, our room faced a school and unfortunately we were woken earlier than we would have liked because of the kids running around outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Shawn215
Reviews.Content: This was a nice find. The hotel was very clean and very accomodating. We were able to drop of our bags before check in, and go out for a few hours. The room itself was very clean and very modern inside. The ability to actually open your window and lean outside was nice, you don't normally get that in hotels. The location was excellent. Overall it was a great place, nothing really over the top, but it got the job done for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very recommendable”
Reviews.Author: ancaria
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, modern style, with large room including a small kitchen with microwave; room was quite clean, the beds were comfortable - we slept very well. You have internet access in the room, but no WLAN, so don't forget the LAN cable. Free internet access also via PC in the lobby, if you don't want to bring your own Notebook. The location is great, directly at the beginning of Gran Vía, metro station "Plaza de Espana" was a 3 min walk away; the Palacio Real was app. 5 min away, we walked to la Latina, Chueca, the center, even to the Prado (which is quite a walk but cross the whole town, so we could do a lot of sightseeing). Next time in Madrid, I'll definitely book a room here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Moshe-My
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the staff was very nice and willing to help with everything. The room was big and comfortable, with a small kitchen Very close to the Plaza de España metro station and the gran via (minutes walk to the Sol and Plaza Mayor) Liked the Best: location, quiet hotel. big and nice room and good staff. Least: the internet connection in our room didn't worked (but the Wifi from the reception desk did worked at the room, but the reception was weak). Overall it was a great hotel, and I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good, functional business hotel conveniently located in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: atp79
Reviews.Content: Suites Viena does all things well. It is well priced, it is well located, it is well equipped and it has good service. We stayed for 1 night and found the pricing to be competitive, the staff were welcoming and the rooms were newly furnished. The hotel is modern, spacious and I would say t was designed for business travellers predominently. There isn't too much character or charm to this hotel - but that is not it's aim. The rooms come with kitchen facilities but these have to be requested. The beds were firm but still comfortable and the hotel is located on a back street so is fairly quiet. Breakfast selection was broad with a lot of choice. If you are looking for a friendly, modern functional hotel in Madrid, it is worth a go.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but they should not nickel and dime the customer”
Reviews.Author: fogsmom
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and the room, though basic is fine, clean, bed is comfortable. location is good and street was quiet - some nice cafe's and bars in the neighborhood. One of the reasons we rented was that kitchen facilties are available - but we found out that you have to request dishes/coffee cups cutlery etc ( which came promptly) and if you want soap to wash up you have to purchase it - ( seems silly - do they want you to leave dirty dishes in the sink?) There is internet in the room via cable - "free" - as long as you rent a cable or bought your own. - alternative is to go to the lobby and use free wifi - the hotel is basically fine and the staff are nice but the "pay extra" bits are somewhat annoying

Reviews.Title: “All in all we had a good stay at Suites Viena”
Reviews.Author: MrsPiket
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located close to Plaza de Espana. Metro, cinemas and restaurants are at walking distance. Café Viena is just up the road. Staffs are friendly and helpful, adequate service from housekeeping. With well over 90 Euros a night without breakfast Suites Viena does not come cheap, it provides quality but is operated as a cash-cow. At 12 Euros per person the breakfast is overpriced. We asked and were granted the two-for-one breakfast. Some days we also made breakfast ourselves in the mini-kitchen. The room was good, the bathroom is small and somewhat cramped. The kitchen is only suitable for modest self-catering like making a salad. We had to ask for crockery, coffeepot, cutlery, etc., which housekeeping brought quickly. However no soap or brush for washing dishes was provided. The window can be opened, some noise however from the street in the night. Complimentary cable internet in the room and free internet in the lobby. Furniture and bed begin to shows signs of being worn out. The table was unstable, some of the springs of the mattress were loose. Suites Viena room outfit and furniture soon need a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value”
Reviews.Author: MoreTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Suites Vienna on our first night in Madrid and were pleasantly surprised by the value for the price. The hotel is reasonably close to many attractions by metro. Our room was clean and a solid three star accomodation. It included a small refrigerator and microwave, which we appreciated. Unfortunately, we could not get the wi-fi to work on our computer. The complimentary computer/printer in the lobby was monopolized by a woman who appeared to be associated with the hotel, so no luck there. I managed to persuade her to relinquish the computer long enough to print our train tickets, thankfully. Overall, we probably would seek other accomodations next time but this hotel was quiet, comfortable and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Quiet, Efficient”
Reviews.Author: Traverler1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern, clean, quiet hotel in a big, noisy city, this is it. The style is stark and minimalist. Everything is white. If you want old world Spanish style in a hotel, with a restaurant, bar, pool, fitness center, etc., this isn't it. The hotel appears to cater to business people, which makes sense because it is located in a business neighborhood. However, it is a neighborhood with local shops and madrilenos going about their daily life. The hotel is on a quiet side street one and a half blocks from the Plaza de Espana, la Calle de Princesa, and the Gran Via. It is about a 10 minute walk from the Royal Palace. The entire city center is within a 30 minute walk of the hotel. The hotel is around the corner from the Temple of Debod. The Plaza de Espana Metro stop is nearby. The Metro system is safe and easy to use and understand. It is an easy metro ride from the airport. Take line 8 to Nuevos Ministerios and then change to Line 10 to the Plaza de Espana. Walk along the far side of the Plaza (away from the Gran Via) and walk down from the Calle de Princesa. The hotel is on the third street on your right. Take the Metro if you don't have a lot of luggage. It only costs 2 Euros. There is also a new bus service from the airport to Madrid which also costs only 2 Euros. But it only has stops near Cibeles, Retiro and Atocha. You would have to take a cab, the Metro, or walk(far with luggage) from one of those stops. I found check-in efficient and friendly. They were helpful with dinner reservations, directions, calling a taxi and with suggestions for restaurants, The service was efficient, friendly, and unobtrusive. The rooms were cleaned daily with a change of towels. You can open a window for fresh air, or if it is cold, turn on the heat. It works well. I slept well every night . Other reviews said that the bathroom was small. I have seen much smaller in Europe. There is a very spacious counter, large mirrors and a tub with a shower with 1/2 of a shower door. The shower is powerful and the hot water is plentiful. I didn't use the kitchenette, but it was also clean with many cabinets. The room itself is large compared to many in big European cities. I chose this hotel because of reviews that said it was quiet and clean. I would add comfortable, efficient and close to the center of everything without being actually in the middle of the loud, chaotic city. I will definitely stay here again when I return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Bel_17
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Nothing unexpect. It's clean, the staff are polite. The bathroom was good, beds were nice and solid. Our room had plenty of space. Quite close to the Plaza del Sol Metro station so great for transport. Breakfast was OK - lots of sweet things, there are plenty of restauraunts around so if breakfast hadn't been included I would have been happy to go elsewhere. My parents had a suite with a balcony, was very nice to be able to sit out at the table and chairs. As others have mentioned, you have to request cutlery and crockery etc.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ker_10
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms for the price. Rooms including small kitchenette, with some but not many dishes and utensils provided upon request. Staff are friendly and accommodating. Wireless internet available in the hotel lobby, and also in a few rooms located close to lobby. There is a computer in the lobby with a printer for use (with small cost for printing), although there can be a line. The immediate neighborhood is relatively free of tourists, and has many convenient supermarkets. It's a shorter walk than you'd think from looking at the map to many of the main tourist attractions (art museums, Plaza Mayor and Palacio Royal) -- alternatively, they are also a short subway ride away, although most destinations requires a transfer at the Puerta del Sol station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but be careful”
Reviews.Author: kingtako
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Comments were true to form. The hotel offered a 2 for 1 breakfast buffet (12.96 euro for 2). Free wi-fi available in the lobby. While using my own computer in the lobby, a women's purse was stolen from her chair while she was getting her breakfast and her grandson was seated at the table. It is a very small hotel and I was very surprised that this happened in a instant because the lobby is intimate and not a lot of traffic. Be mindful of your personal items. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: jebndelorus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites Viena for two nights in October 2010. We were very impressed with Laura on reception who was excellent. We showed up very early as we'd arrived on the overnight train, and she allowed us to store our bags until our room was ready. She then upgraded us to a junior suite to apologise that our room wasn't ready (we weren't expecting it to be!). She was on reception several times during our stay and was very pleasant and helpful. Out junior suite was nice - large room and terrace, thought bathroom was a little on the small side. It could be better if a few details were addressed: - Our TV took around 3 minutes to come on every time we tried to use it - The speaker in the bathroom which was supposed to relay the sound from the TV didn't work - There were mucky handprints on the bathroom ceiling where workmen had obviously had to remove the tiles for maintenance - The hotel doesn't provide cutlery, plates etc automatically - you have to ask for these, which I think is silly and isn't the way most apart/suite hotels work Those are very minor niggles, I appreciate, but they do niggle and are preventing this hotel from getting a 5/5 from ourselves. The area is lovely - it reminded us a lot of the nicer parts of Charlottenburg in Berlin. It's dead easy to reach the two metro stops, or the cable car. We always felt safe and the area is quiet day and night. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast, head up to the Viena Cafe up the road, or one of the eateries on the Rosales - much cheaper. Good places to eat on the Rosales at night too, and a great Ice Cream Shop (Bruin) near the cable car, too. The only other downside of our stay was at check out when a lady's handbag was stolen. She'd left it on a seat, and two men walked in, grabbed it and ran. She had obviously been careless, and it wasn't typical of our experience of the area, but does highlight the need to be careful and vigilant. Hotel staff were very helpful and called the police for her etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarloMarlo
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel that I would ranked as a 4 star rather than 3 star. New facilities, modern style. Large, clean room and bathroom. Very comfortable mattress. Kitchenette is a nice addition. Perfectly central, yet quiet location. Didn't have any problem with Wi-Fi in my room. Safe area. 2 minutes walking distance to Plaza de España and to the nearest stop of Hop-On Hop-Off bus. Quick and easy check in/check out. Staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. We had very special personal situation that would required hotel staff involvement. Many thanks to two receptionist ladies who handled it perfectly well. If you look for the nice, quiet room in centrally located hotel at reasonable night rate look no further. No doubts you will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “awesome but no wifi!”
Reviews.Author: misspixels
Reviews.Content: Love the place all the way! Love the rooms, the situation (everything you need is near). Near a grocery, restaurant, metro station, bar, tapas, vino, near La Grand Via, near everything! but. No wifi in the rooms. I think in 2010 wifi in rooms is a necessity like shampoo ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, great value”
Reviews.Author: SMW20
Reviews.Content: Easy to find from the metro station, don't be put off by the general area, it is well placed for all the attractions and transport. We walked around at all hours and never had any concerns. The receptionist was very welcoming and helpful on arrival and the check-in efficient. The hotel had granted our pre-visit request for a quiet room at the rear of the property away from the lift. The room was very spacious, clean and well equipped. The bathroom was small but well planned and had the added bonus of a bath as well as a shower - very welcome after walking round the city. The bed was comfortable and the air-conditioning efficient, there was also an opening window if you wanted fresh air. Free internet access in the lobby was handy though often busy - if you take your own laptop there is a free internet port in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: emarsh20
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers easy access to Madrid's subway system, and is located in a quiet and lovely part of town. The room was beautiful, and my boyfriend and I really enjoyed the huge patio. My only complaint is that the internet in the room didn't work, but it was easy to go down to the lobby to use the internet there. Overall, this is a fantastic hotel with a really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Green Boutique, sometimes also means "Bare"”
Reviews.Author: Drewjo1437
Reviews.Content: Suites Viena is in a great location, about 2 blocks from a great park, the metro, Plaza Espana, a couple of supermarkets and the big chain department store El Cortes Ingles. The neighborhood is very quiet, but a quick walk to food (Gran Via) and happenings. The rooms in this hotel are huge, especially by European standards. Actually, they're pretty comfortable by American standards as well. The hotel has embraced energy reduction by requiring your room key to also operate the electricity in the room. This is done by having the key loaded in a key slot on the entry hall wall. The downside to this is that there is no clock in the room. Also, the king size bed situation is two twin beds, made up separately, tight enough for a quarter to bounce off and go through the ceiling, and pushed together on a king size frame. The mattress is like sleeping on a cinder block. Suggestion to the hotel: please purchase a few true King Size mattresses and a soft mattress pad to boot. It would kick up the ratings on this hotel another notch for sure!! There is a mini kitchenette, but I found it almost a waste of space in that there is no cookery to actually use it. Also, there is no iron, not just unavailable in the room, but unavailable in the entire hotel. (I've been informed from other this is the norm throughout Spain). Travel with one if needed. (Very pricey to have the hotel iron a shirt for you). The free internet use in the lobby was excellent and the front desk was always helpful with any question/issue we had. Like others posted, the hotel breakfast is overpriced. BUT, Americans beware, there is not a scrambled egg to be had anywhere nearby (atleast that we could find for 4 days straight). If you have an insane love of ham, you will be in pork heaven in Madrid! :) All in all, Suites Viena was a great stay for price, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: jhgreen32
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 18-year old son and stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. It was lovely, quiet, modern, immaculately clean, offered breakfast daily for a fee (it was not included in our room charge), well-situated an easily walkable distance from the Plaza de Espana Metro stop and also nearby the Royal Palace and the Temple of Debod. The hotel staff was very helpful, free wifi in the lobby and a computer there for guest use as well. Near to some good restaurants in the neighborhood. With a Metro tourist pass you can use the Metro and city buses however much you want (purchase at the Metro for the number of consecutive days you will be in Madrid).

Reviews.Title: “Great, modern city hotel in fascinating neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Merimaria
Reviews.Content: At first Hotel Suites Viena seems to be a bit far away from the city centre of Madrid, but there´s so much going on in many different locations around the city that despite any location you would probably still end up walking a lot or using metro anyway to get around. So having Plaza de España and it´s metro station just about three blocks from the hotel, makes the location really good. The hotel itself met all my expectations and we really enjoyed our stay there. We came there by car and they do have a parking hall next to the hotel (about 22e / day), but especially on evenigns and sundays, it´s a great saving to park the car free on streets around. The reception staff was friendly and polite and somehow we also got upgraded to a supersior room for our stay. The room was absolutely great; large room with kitchen corner decorated with light colours and modern furnitures. There was plenty of storage space, safe box, huge balcony, large fridge and overall the kitchen was very functional. The only tiny downside was that the bathroom was pretty small, especially compered to the room itself. The area around Calle de Juan Álvarez Mendizábal is peaceful and great for movie enthusiasts, cause there are three movie theathers specialiced in non-mainstream local and foreign movies shown in original languages. Of course Templo de Debod and The Royal Palace are also within a walking distance and to Puerta del Sol it´s not that bad either by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but still in the center”
Reviews.Author: nissan11
Reviews.Content: We had booked 4 rooms at this hotel and stayed for 4 days. The hotel is well located at a short walk to the Plaza de Espanya metro. It is within walking distance to the Royal Palace as well as some of the main shopping areas in Madrid. The rooms were very large (especially for a European city). the rooms had a stove, Microwave and separate dining area. The bathrooms were a bit small compared to the room but very clean. Hotel provided Free Wifi access and utensils. The staff was helpful in providing local information. The hotel has a breakfast but we did not try it as it wasn't included in our room. The hotel was very reasonably priced for the kind of facilities it provides

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel for Plaza de Espana and nearby station”
Reviews.Author: geonic
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8pm after long flight through Frankfurt from Tokyo. Staff member spoke English and was helpful. Room was modern and comfortable. Breakfast better than adequate and good value. No noise from other rooms but we could hear conversation from the street. Not much traffic but occasionally there was noise. For us the location was excellent because we were renting a car from Hertz at Plaza de Espana which was nearby and getting out of the city was quite easy.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: HeadBrewerEngland
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend this hotel and previous good reviews were spot on! Very convenient for everything and a short walk to the bus stop, The Metro and City Centre. Did have own microwave in room but no cutlery or crockery!! Not needed because you can eat so well in Madrid and at a reasonable cost. Staff were brilliant and was chambermaid service. We ate breakfast locally close to Hotel which was better value for money. Top tip to eat and drink in Madrid is to visit Mercado San Miguel. What a brilliant concept and great food, wine and beer!!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet location in a lively city”
Reviews.Author: tejaskhara
Reviews.Content: We had a short 2 day stay in Madrid and booked the hotel based on tripadvisor ratings. Must say we were very happy with the decision. Had never expected such large, clean and modern rooms in Madrid at such great value. The room had almost everything we needed for our short stay. The bathrooms were a little small though. The staff was very helpful in planning our day and also helped us with our travel to airport. The lobby gives access to free internet. The hotel was in a quiet street, but was a 2 min walk from Place de Espana metro station and was only a couple of stations away from the Sol station (Central Madrid). The Royal Palace is also a 5 min walk from the hotel. The location is perfect if you want a quiet stay which is close to the city centre Did not try the hotel food, but the breakfast looked fine. Loved the spacious & modern rooms. Did not like the small bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Clean, Clean”
Reviews.Author: amirhassanm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Suites Viena during an international exhibition so it was difficult to find nice hotels with reasonable price. I was lucky enough to find this hotel. I believe regarding the value it is number one in Madrid. Hotel is located near Plaza De Espana, close to city center (15 min walking) but in a very quiet area. Actually I cannot imagine staying near Sol or Plaza Mayor where music bands playing until midnight. The Debod temple is just one block away (a must see in Madrid) and Palacio Real is accessible in less than 10 minutes. Rooms are big with enough space for baggage, although it is lengthy and narrow. Rooms are furnished with Two sofas, one small table, one chair, a desk, a wrack of 12 clothes hangers, Laptop size safe and a small kitchen. The main positive point about Hotel is cleanness. Rooms, bathroom, corridors and lobby are all very clean. Breakfast is simple especially for dairy fans. Breakfast room is also small so sometimes you must wait to find a free seat. Staff are polite and helpful but serious. it is a surprise if you find a staff with a smile on leaps. All in all I do recommend this hotel if you are looking for value. If you do not care about price, maybe other choices are also available.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: denisjimenez50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. It is tucked away down a side street away from the noise of the hustle and bustle of the centre, but close to the centre to be able to enjoy it. The hotel its self is brilliant. The rooms are very clean and are cleaned every day, it was great going out for the day and coming back to a fresh clean room. The staff are very helpful and very nice. The whole of the hotel is just spotless! There was three of us sharing a room, 1 double and 1 single.
