There was a little kitchenette, but you have to ask for the untensils etc. The kitchen comprised of 2 ring top cooker, a microwave, sink, a fridge that had a mini bar ( that was expensive to use) we just brought our own stuff and put in the fridge, they don't mind you using it. The bathroom was long and narrow but it was okay and very clean. Towels were changed every day. The shower was a power shower. We were very close to the centre. Metros are so easy to get on and off. From Barajas airport to plaza espana will cost 2euros because you have to pay a suppliment. However to get around from A - B it just cost a euro no matter where you go around the city. The metro is so clean and cool. There is a big TV in the middle of the tracks to entertain the public while waiting for the metro. You don't have to have wait for long though. There is no pushing and shoving on them either, as there is always plenty of room. For you are eating out, it can be very expensive, especially if you want to eat outside, you pay almost double to what is advertised. If you go to the Plaza Mayor you can have a 'bocadillo de calamares' (A baguette filled with calamares) or spanish omelete, or ham and a beer or soft drink for 4 euros. The plaza mayor is a place to visit. A beautiful square with little street cafes around the outside, painters, and street entertainers. Well worth sitting out side just to take in the atmosphere of it all. The buildings in madrid are fantastic. The royal palace and the cathedral are just a short walk from the hotel. It is fantastic, the building is just so breath taking and to be able to walk so close to it was amazing. It was lovely day or night walking around. There is a park straight opposite, el jardin del oriente, with plenty of seats to sit down and trees and bushes, amazing statues stand high on pedel stools. Street cafes sit around the outside of the park. There is also a park very close to the hotel one to the side, plaza espana and another one opposite with another park in the inside with prize winning roses. Well worth a walk round. If you are going to do some catering, recommend the DIA supermarket very cheap and is just round the corner and down the road from the hotel. We had breakfast at el cortes ingles, as it was cheaper than the hotel. The hotel charged us 10 euros each, in el cortes ingles 3 coffees, churros (fried dough), 2 toasted baguettes with butter and jam and freshly squeezed oranged juice (3 glasses) served at your table with waiters in black and white suites who are so very nice, for just 7 euros for the three of us. The only thing is that it doesn't open until 10am. We did find another little cafe Nabraska which is just up the road from the cafe and they were open very early. Also very nice with uniformed staff just willing to help you. We had the same there, 1 coffee and churros is only 2euros 30 cents! cheaper than a cup of coffee than costas in britain. We found no matter where we went for a coffee, the coffees were just so nice, tasted of coffee, and were so cheap, about a 1.60 euro a cup. When every you order a beer and soft drinks, they bring you little tapas with it. We have had bowls of crisps, olives and tuna and peppers on little tiny pieces of bread. We had that every where we went. We went to central Madrid to see the museum, The buildings again makes you want to walk around with your head up in the air. They are just so fantatic. The Prado Museum was brilliant. It costs 7 Euros each, however, if you have a student card you can get in for 4 euros and if you are an OAP. In the evenings you can get in for free between 6-8pm. Well worth a visit. There is tight security when you go in, your bags are put into an xray machine. The Retiro park opposite the museum is a great place for a walk round. You could be there for hours though it is so big. Very beautiful park, very green, lakes and lots of play areas for all sorts of ages, from the tiny weenies with a giant sand pit and swings and slides for them, to juniors and also an adult play area with exercise bars etc. There was quite a few people using them! There is the cristal palace in the centre with a large lake, full of fish, large ones! and also terripins, loads of them! ducks and swans too, beautiful brown ducks and a beautiful black swan! There is a big boating lake in the middle of the park. On the whole Madrid and the Suites Viena is well worth going to. The weather was very hot, 38C some days, but it didn't feel stuffy or sweaty, you can easily walk around in it all day long, as long as you drink plenty of water. Madrid a city full of art and culture.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: happygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel a few minutes walk from one of two Metro stations, a third is a bit further. Very clean and comfortable hotel with a useful kitchen area - sink, fridge, etc. Bathroom very small - door just cleared the basin when open, but all immaculately clean. Clean towels daily. Flat screen TV but the only English channels were SKY News and BBC World News. Blackout curtains a great idea! Our room was at the back, and very quiet. Wide range of food at breakfast - ranging from eggs and frankfurters to sandwiches, tortilla, rolls, cheese, cakes, chopped fresh fruit. One free internet computer in reception, free ADSL in the room (take a network cable). Near the hop-on hop-off tourist bus. The Royal Palace and Cathedral about 15 mins walk away. Also went on the train from Atocha Renfe to Toledo for the day, about 30 mins journey, about 18 Euros each return. Once there you need to take a bus to the old city as it is a long walk uphill. Would recommend you book your train ticket in advance as the train can get full (you can do this at the station). The cathedral is well worth the entrance fee and also the audio guide which talks about 18 different sites in the cathedral. El Rastro and The Prado also worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GNRMatt
Reviews.Content: We spent our final night in Spain at the Suites Viena. It's unfortunate we didn't get to spend more time here as the room was exquisite. Everything was very clean and modern. Our room came with a huge balcony and a kitchenette. Since this was our last night after 10 days adventuring around the country, we were pretty exhausted by the time we got here. It felt good relaxing here on our last night. The location of the hotel is quite central, as it is located right off the busy Calle Princesa and near Plaza Espana. They have their own parking garage (at the price of 22.50 Euros per day) and a friendly staff. Please feel free to check out our further travel reviews at betterthanatravelguide.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern suites hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: monmac
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern, but comfortable hotel. All immaculate rooms have kitchen facilities and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a top floor suite which had large roof terrace! Staff all very pleasant and helpful. Well situated only 2 minutes from Plaza Espana and 5 minutes walk from the Palacio Royal. Lots of small shops and cafes around - would recommend "cascaras" cafe restaurant, on nearby C/Ventura Rodriguez,7 - great food at very reasonable prices (including vegetarian dishes) - we had dinner and breakfast there - wish we had found it sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: MandH-eurotrippers
Reviews.Content: We agree with all of the other positive reviews on Trip Advisor – Suites Viena is a very good smoke free hotel to stay at when visiting Madrid. It’s a fairly new six storey building comprising 50 studios, 5 junior suites and 2 senior suites. We treated ourselves to one of the junior suites for a long weekend over May Day and were not disappointed, even though we ended up close to the road on the first floor, (we prefer rooms on higher floors if possible). The hotel is located only 100+ yards up from Plaza Espana but it’s unbelievably quiet for the centre of a major city. This more than compensates for the fact it’s not a very pretty road. Luckily, most of the traffic uses neighbouring through roads. Even the school playground opposite did not bother us as we slept in to well past 9:00am every morning! Our junior suite was clean, light and airy, and uncluttered, with a fully tiled bathroom and laminate flooring elsewhere. Looking at the floor plan on the back of our door, it was about double the size of the studios, (which most reviewers seem to think are themselves quite spacious), with a separate bedroom that has a huge walk in wardrobe. All rooms have a lounge area and a kitchenette with sink, electric rings, microwave and minibar/fridge, but you will have to ask for things like kettle, cups etc if you want to use the facilities. There was a nice LCD TV in the lounge area and another in the bedroom, but only two English language news stations. Breakfast, which is served until 10.30am weekdays and 11.00am weekends was included at a discounted rate by the online hotel agents we used. We don’t think we would have paid full price if we had not booked in advance, but for us there was a reasonable choice to start the day, even though the scrambled eggs tended to remain empty once they were gone. If you arrive by air you can catch Line 8 metro down to Nuevo Minesterios where you need to change to Line 10, which will take you to Plaza Espana. The hotel is about 5 minutes from the station. A single ticket from the airport is 2€ including the 1€ airport surcharge. Ventura Rodriguez station on Line 3 is slightly closer but not worth the extra metro change with luggage. If, like us, you are not a fan of other people’s cigarette smoke, you may find it difficult to identify somewhere to eat in Madrid that is smoke free. Apparently, a bill to introduce a public places smoking ban at a future date is expected soon. In the meantime, you could consult the nofumadores.org website which lists non smoking establishments. Finally, watch where you walk. Although we loved Madrid, unfortunately, dog pooh is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ljd619
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through Tripadvisor and decided to go with it based on the wonderful reviews from other travelers. I tend to be picky about cleanliness and value for my dollar when it comes to hotels - I must say that this hotel definitely met all my expectations, including an amazing price. My husband and I stayed at Viena Suites for a week, the front desk staff is very helpful, especially Laura. She was lovely and very accomodating. Breakfast is usually 12Euros, but they were having a 2x1 offer, so we both ate breakfast a couple of times for the price of one. They have a wonderful spread from sandwiches to deli meats, eggs, sausage, churros, cereal, fruit, delicious juices, tea, coffee, milk, etc. If you book online through their website you can choose a discount or free breakfast offer. The room was very spacious, clean and modern. It included a microwave, mini fridge, sink, pot/pan, plates, utensils, glasses, mugs and even a electric kettle. Room has individual temperature control, and AC works really well. Hotel doesnt have lots of amenities, but since we spent our days sight seeing and experiencing the culture it was just perfect. It is very close to city center (Sol) and walking distance to many attractions - the metro is about 5 minutes away in Plaza de Espana (if needed). Overall, we were very happy and satisfied - and will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value great hotel great staff great location”
Reviews.Author: WZ1227
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor along with several other hotels we stayed at on a 5 week tour of Turkey/Israel/Spain. This hotel was an excellent choice. My wife is critical about where we stay so I'm always careful with hotels I book. We booked the Jr Suite on the 6th floor. The room is spacious, clean and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful. The room includes a refrigerator, and microwave. The location of the hotel is very good, close to many top attractions with but a short taxi or bus ride to the Prado and other museums. At well under $200 a night this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JoanneW
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fantastic long weekend in Madrid. Hotel was well located in a quiet street. Metro stop was just a couple of minutes away and main tourist attractions a mere ten minute walk. This is a modern, clean, city hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel as the continenal breakfast was quite pricey and a good cup of coffee and pastry could be found in cafes nearby for a couple of euros. The staff were friendly and helpful and our room was both spacious and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeeAndalucia
Reviews.Content: location is very close to parks and palace and Plaza Espana, but far enough from Plazas so that you can sleep. Good choice for the first day after that long international flight. Triple room was large enough with real bed. No musty smell, very clean. (we have asthma so this matters to us). My teenager liked the computer with internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: r88my
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel. Very modern and clean, rooms are very spacious. There is also a little kitchen area in the room. The hotel is 2mins from the metro station and so all areas of madrid are easliy accessable. The hotel is also very close to the temple of debod and around 10mins walk to the royal palace area.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: navygreen
Reviews.Content: Pros: hotel was environmentally friendly with lights on automatic timers, etc. Cons: parking was 25% of our total cost, no washclothes in bathroom, and "two separate beds" in english apparently means "one large single bed" in spanish. Room was clean, but small. People working reception were not terribly helpful providing directions to the hotel over the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find!!”
Reviews.Author: nubianlaydeetee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night early in March 2010 This hotel was quite basic – but clean! The colours scheme is neutral but they have no pictures / prints up in the room as decoration – this would add a bit more character! Just two minutes walk to the Placa de Espana (metro) – just on the end of Gran Via. The kitchenette is a great idea – all you have to do is ask for crockery, kettle etc and it would be brought up to you. The staff were friendly and helpful – even when my room developed a leak – I was re-located within 5 minutes – excellent service! I would definitely stay here again when in Madrid – Really good value for money! The only downside is the school (playground) located directly in front of the hotel. This was not much of an issue for me as I was out and about, but If I were staying longer I would request a room at the rear of the property so as not to be disturbed too much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, homey”
Reviews.Author: Jeurop
Reviews.Content: First, let me say, I loved my week in Old Madrid - and I felt sad leaving my "home away from home" at SV. It was the most relaxing vacation I've had in my lifetime and this room was quiet, comfortable and perfectly located. I did miss having dishes and silverware in the kitchenette, and, an iron and ironing board. But that's okay. I liked the sounds of the children and music playing in the school playground below my room and will always associate them with my pleasant stay at Suites Vienna. Others might not find that charming, but I did. I liked being within short walking distance of TWO Metro stations and having easy access to restaurants, tapas bars, shops, ATMs and parks in the immediate area. It sounds hard to believe, but the vending machine sandwich I had there: chorizo and egg on white bread, was the best sandwich I had during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “I wish this chain was i more locations... very happy”
Reviews.Author: ZacharyS
Reviews.Content: Though the staff was a bit surley, this place was great. Comfortable large rooms, nice baths, easy walking distrance to restaraunts, entertainment, and the subway. The one thing I didn't quite understand is why you have a stove top in the rooms but don't provide any pots or pans? Will stay here again when I get back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good room”
Reviews.Author: ottawanian
Reviews.Content: We went to madrid for a 5 day trip (incl Toledo), we spent close to a month looking for a good, affordable and centrally located hotel and this hotel had all those points. The room was clean and spacious. The room had everything along with a little kitchen and stove to cook however the bathroom was a little small. Nothing too fancy but staff was quite friendly but the best of all was the absolutely perfect location. Almost all the major attractions were a 15 min walk. The metro was about a 5 min walk. Lots of restaurants close by. the main shopping district was within walking distance too. We didnt try the breakfast there, it was alot of toast, muffins, coffee ets for 10 euros but we found a little retaurant close by that had great churros and breakfast for 3 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Suites Viena is Clean, Extremely Customer Friendly , and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: psgeorockclimber
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was right on target. The hotel is very well run, clean, rooms are bigger than normal, back side is very quiet, the breakfast looks well appointed but higher than we wanted to spend, and the location was perfect for touring and jogging. Once you get your bearings, you will find that the hotel is four short blocks from the Plaza de Espana or Ventura Rodiguez metro stops , light food supplies, and cafes are right down the block or a couple of streets away depending on your tastes and budget. The Temple de Debod (Egyptian Temple moved piece by piece in 1968) and continuous parks were truly amazing for morning running/walking and evening strolls. The staff answered every question presented with enthusiasm and a real desire to serve as requested. It is also nice that you can use your credit card in USD or euros. My credit card doesn't charge the 3% if our various hotels submit USD amounts versus foreign currencies. I give this hotel a high rating. I have already recommended this hotel to a number of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maximus80
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed for 3 nights in the Viena Suites Hotel. It was very good. Very spacious and clean room, with a very convenient kitchen with a microwave oven. However, there is a kids school just in front the hotel. The kids do make a lot of noise. It´s something to consider if you´re going to stay on a working day. That aside, the location was perfect, with the subway just a 5 minute walking away, near the Gran Via and the Plaza de España. There is also some buying machines on the hall, where you can get water, cold drinks, some snacks and coffee. Very convenient. I would defintely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mpjc121
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some colleagues on a business trip in Nov 2009 and found this hotel to be perfectly adequate. If you are looking for frills like 24 hr room service, onsite gym, hotel bar and restaurant, this is not it. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity around Plaza Espana too so you wonlt go hungry. The hotel was clean, spacious and the front desk staff (esp Daniel) were very accessible and friendly. The young woman who works the breakfast buffet in the morning is really nice and does understand English (although she will try and get you to ask in Spanish which really helped me to learn it) and also German. My only comment is that the shower/bathtub combo with the half glass partition can be tricky with the water spraying on the floor sometimes. The temperature in the rooms was not the best either and the room felt cold some nights even when I had the heat turned up high. There are vending machines in the lobby for drinks and snacks too if you do get hungry and don't want to raid the minibar. Overall it was great for under a week's stay but any longer and I would probably look at something with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel near city center”
Reviews.Author: raddocmed
Reviews.Content: Convenient loacation within easy walking distance of the Museums and city center. Typical modern hotel. Room was comfortable and clean. Had Internet and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: EmmaHi
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. very easy access to everywhere in the city. the prices was reasonable compared to hotels in big european cites. staff were so friendly and helpful. the room was clean and very comfortable. All my colleagues also enjoyed staying here very much. there were also many restaurent and cafe around. they served good dishes and drink and very well designed. it's very worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan
Reviews.Content: About a 5-minute walk from Plaza Espana made the hotel very convenient. Although the Metro at Plaza Espana is a labyrinthe, you can get anywhere from there. Just give yourselves lots of time to find the right train line and boarding platform. Plenty of small cafes nearby. We really liked the tapas bar on the corner (above the hotel). A selection of fun tapas for 2 euros, plus great sangria. Room was generous, but bed was hard. Didn't bother us too much. Because Spain is a late-night country, there is always noise on the street at night, precluding leaving your windows open (and why doesn't anyone in Europe use screens....). We had some "borrachos" (drunks) on the street walking by,2 or 3 of the 5 nights we were there. It wasn't specific to the hotel. Also, don't plan on sleeping in (you should be out exploring anyway) during the week, because there is a grammar school across the street whose playground gets noisy by about 10 a.m. Some typical lacks for an American: no tissues and no wash cloths or dish cloths for the kitchenette. By the way, you have to ask for the dishes/pots/pans etc at the front desk, as they are not stocked in the kitchenette. We booked through Hotels.com and got quite a good rate, but it did not include breakfast. There are a number of shops with a couple of block that sell breakfast sandwiches, which you can buy the night before and stick in the frig and then microwave. About 2 1/2 euros apiece. With a kitchenette, full breakfast not really necessary. Our only major complaint was that they didn't notify us in any way of the time change, so we were an hour early for a tour we had booked. When we asked, they said it never occurred to them that anyone wouldn't know. Other than that (and a slightly surly housekeeper who brought the items for the kitchen), we had no problem with the service. Would stay there again on a return visit because of the location and price and size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very clean, but service is not a strong point.”
Reviews.Author: celtictravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is a good value. It is very minimalist and no frills. The rooms are as pictured in the photos but are starting to show some wear and tear. Overall they were very clean, location is great. A short walk to so many attractions. The longest walk was to Retiro Park and the Prado but it only took 20 minutes. Breakfast was included which was a good value. The only complaint was that the internet in the lobby and room did not work most of the time we were there and when I mentioned it to 2 different people at the front desk the basically shrugged their shoulders and said there was nothing they could do to help. As long as you are looking for a clean room and not many extras this place is a great value in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room for Excellent Price but the Location Could be More Central”
Reviews.Author: Chocolate-phile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suites Vienna for 1 week during October 2009. The location is about 5 minute fast walk to the main street of Gran Via and a good 25 minute walk to the Museum Triangle. The price was excellent (the 2 of us stayed for approximately AUD$150/night). The rooms were extremely spacious, very modern, clean and even had a small kitchenette. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful, spoke English and made the booking for us to see a Flamenco performance (Corral de la Morería is fabulous!). An additional bonus was the one lobby computer which had access to free internet which was very useful. I would recommend this hotel for its service and hotel room standard but the location of the hotel could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the Center of the City and Plaza de Espana”
Reviews.Author: Marvelous_Travelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 2 blocks off of Gran Via and is clean comfortable and well appointed. The rooms are large by European size and they even have a small kitchenette should you want to heat up some water for tea, use a microwave or need a refridgerator. We stayed for one night and found it easy to navigate around the city and get to all the sites we wanted to see. The staff was friendly and I would recommend this to anyone who is looking to save a little money by staying only two short blocks off the main drag. Completely worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: lilikoi
Reviews.Content: Very pleased. I booked here after reading the TA's reviews. for 89Euro we had a lovely room with mini kitchen, breakfast included and a rollaway bed for our 6 year old daughter. Location is perfect. Cost about 30 Euro from the airport to hotel. very close to the metro and beautiful parks with playgrounds for the kids. Would stay there again for sure! Bed was hard, internet free in lobby (couldn't ge in room DSL to work) AC would not turn on- I think it was off for the season. otherwise perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not tourist friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderers26
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at this hotel on our trip to Madrid and thought it was closer to the center of town but it was a good 20 minutes walk and was too far away to be useful for a tourist. We had to walk through a dark park to get to the hotel which was a little disconcerting at times. It seems to be a business hotel. The staff were briskly efficient but not friendly or particularly helpful. Our room was in the front of the hotel right across the street from a grammar school which was very noisy in the morning. The next day we asked and they gave us a room in the back which was much quieter. The room itself is very big and sparsely furnished with only a bed and 4 chairs and a flat screen on a stand. There was a small table which we had to use for one of our suitcases but could have used a suitcase stand or somewhere to put our other suitcase instead of having to keep it on the floor. The bathrooms nice and modern. The breakfast was very expensive. I left a magnifying mirror in my first room attached to the door mirror and asked the front desk on 3 different occasions if someone could retrieve it for me. They all said they would but it never happened and I had to leave without it. Not a bad hotel by any means the rooms were large, minimalistic but comfortable, but not a good location if your sightseeing around Madrid. The one thing that was very helpful was they had one computer in the lobby for free internet which we used on several occasions. I would recommend this hotel for the business traveler but not the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern decor hotel within walking distance of museums”
Reviews.Author: buddymedbery
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Suites Viena is a new-looking hotel with modern decor in downtown Madrid. Although narrow roadways make it somewhat difficult, parking is available as is high-speed internet. Has usual European breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied, If Not Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: RossPhx
Reviews.Content: Good location on a reasonably quiet street, reasonably close to two Metro stops and a short walk from the Temple of Debod, which really should be seen at night. Room was clean, if rather austere. Bathroom was about as small as possible (don’t stub your toe on the metal door stop embedded in the floor in front of the toilet), but then we don’t visit Madrid to stay in the bathroom, do we? Free Internet terminal in the lobby, if you’re lucky enough to catch it when some young woman is not catching up on Facebook friends. The incentives to use the hotel’s website for booking are so confusing even the staff finds them difficult. After being told when and where breakfast is served, I was called on the room phone to be told that breakfast was not included in my rate, because I had selected the discount instead. I think it depends on when you book, not the choice you make, but in any case you are instructed to make sure you request a room without breakfast, if what you want is the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect find - quiet, spacious, immaculately clean, close to metro, restaurants”
Reviews.Author: GandJSydney
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Madrid and Hotel Suites Viena was a perfect choice. Quiet, trendy decor, immaculately clean. The staff were delightful and other reviews were spot on. Close to metro, shops, restaurants - we would highly recommend this hotel particularly having stayed at another extremely noisy hotel 3 weeks earlier.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: havingfuntraveling
Reviews.Content: Great Place, we stayed for two nights and the hotel was exactly what we had read on tripadvisor. Good location, friendly staff, GREAT PRICE. We stayed in a Jr. Suite on the 6th floor, had small kitchenette and a wonderful terrace, all for under a 100 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trekkersocal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the plaza de espana as well as the ventura rodriguez metro stops. Both metro stations are no more than 200-300m away (about 5 min. walk depending on your pace). The hotel is situated in a residential neighborhood with lots of shoppes, restaurants, and cafes, but quiet at night with not much noise. Location was great as you have two metro stations that will take you anywhere you need to be in madrid. The rooms were quiet, spacious for european standards, included a microwave, small refrigerator, and a electric stovetop (cooking utilities were provided). Furniture was simple, desk with internet connection (wireless in the lobby - ask them for password, or if you bring your own ethernet cable, via ethernet jack, you can also borrow one for a 5Euro deposit, refunded at the end of your stay). Internet was fast, not the slow stuff they usually give you at most hotels, plus free! There was also a small ounge area with two chairs, end table, and TV. Beds were firm, like most european hotels. Bathroom consisted of bathtub and sink, not spacious but clean. In-house safebox large enough to fit a laptop and closet and storage space. Front desk were very helpful, there are a few grocery stores nearby as well for those self-caterers (Dia, el cortes ingles dept store downstairs has a supermercado). The lobby has a breakfast area, you can choose free breakfast or 10% discount, we took the discount and so can't comment on the breakfast. Check in was fast and easy. Would stay here again if in madrid. only downside may be if you want to be in the heat of the action of madrid (i.e. nightbars, clubs, touristy sights)... this is not there, but an easy metro ride will get you there. the metro runs till 1:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price/Quality Relationship”
Reviews.Author: supernovea
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel is excellent considering this is a 3-star hotel. It is close to the metro, close to Gran Via and easy to walk to the shopping district. It is located in a quiet street. There was no problem at night. It has wireless internet in the lobby as well as a computer customers are free to use, but in the room you must have a cable (good to know). The room we had was big and clean and had a small kitchen (cook top, microwave). However, there are no utensils nor plates but you can ask for them at the reception. The TV is small but it's ok since I wasn't there to watch TV for hours. On the downside, the room really needed a fresh coat of paint. While I was there, they repainted the entrance hall, so maybe the rooms will follow. In the bathroom, the shower is a bit tricky. It's the shape of a small tub so it has a slope. It would have put a simple shower. For a 3-star hotel, it really was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mclassic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights during my visit to Madrid. The lobby to the hotel is very nice. The staff was friendly and helpful. I was very pleased upon arriving to the room. It was very clean. The decor was modern. The bathroom was also very clean. In terms of location, I would suggest using a map to find your way to the hotel. It is very near to Plaza de Espana on one of the side streets. I made my way to the hotel via subway from the airport to Plaza de Espana. After exiting the station, I asked a couple of local residents if they knew the street the hotel is located on. Fortunately, one happened to know and I was on my way. The very nice thing to this hotel is that it's only 2.5 blocks to the Plaza de Espana subway station. If you can find your way to the station, then there is nothing in Madrid, as far as attractions, that's out of your reach. I also discovered that the hotel is in moderate walking distance to Sol and Gran Via. Take care to watch your surroundings when walking to and from the hotel as some of the streets are dark, and there is not much foot traffic. I felt safe the entire time, however. Also If your cash is limited, or tastes are particular, you can buy your own food and beverages and use the room's stove, microwave and refrigerator. Internet is free. You will need a LAN cable to use it. The front desk will let you borrow one for a deposit of 5 Euros. The only negative is that the room could use some artwork on the walls. Other than that, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is a fine value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, quite and clean room, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ForrestNL
Reviews.Content: We have just came back from Madrid and stayed in this hotel for eight nights. Here I just wanna say that this hotel is the best you can expect from three-stars ones. It is located in a small street near to the Plaza Espana which means round five minutes walk to the metro. It is very quite at night. The staff by the reception are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very nice too and you have many choices. The room is very clean and tidy. The price we got is very competitive. The only pitfalls I may have is the mattress which is too hard. It takes me several nights to get used to it. Secondly the room lacks of bit decoration, I mean like nice paintings etc. Our stay there is absolutely a pleasent exprience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms for a great value”
Reviews.Author: srtram
Reviews.Content: We had a positive experience here. The price can't be beat, and the room was very large. Strangely, the bathroom was tiny, but that wasn't a big deal. Breakfast was included in our price, which was good because there seemed to be not other option right around the hotel. As others have noted, it's an easy walk to the metro and sites like the Royal Palace. However, the street the hotel is on doesn't have the greatest feel to it. There is a free computer to use in the lobby, but unfortunately it was broken while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, lovely staff, fantastic location - all at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: FLKatFamily
Reviews.Content: We picked Suites Vienna over other properties we had used before, based on recommendations from this site. The hotel was terrific, more like a studio apartment than a hotel, ideal for a small family. As others pointed out, the hotel is only minutes from the Plaza de Espana Metro station, and the Madrid Metro is super convenient and felt very safe. The hotel is within walking distance of the Royal Palace, Parque de Oriente (cable car ride) and a Corte Ingles. In fact, you could walk to most of Old Madrid's tourist sites if you were willing to spend 30 minutes. We booked the room through the hotel's web site (if you use their web site to reserve, they may offer a small discount or free breakfast), and requested an extra bed for my daughter, and utensils in the kitchen. Everything was perfectly arranged for our arrival. The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping, were very friendly and helpful. The room was huge for European standards, and every corner was meticulously clean. The mattresses are extra firm (which we liked), and the beds are large, so when they are pushed together, they are super California King size. Corte Ingles and other grocery stores are very close, so we bought some bottled water and fruit and kept them in the minibar - the staff did not seem to mind. We did not really cook, but there was a microwave and a 2 burner stove top, so you could make light meals in the room, if you wanted. Everything about room was very good: the A/C was cold, bathroom was well supplied, water pressure was wonderful, and we had no problems connecting to the internet (our room was on the second floor). This hotel is really ideal for a family stay in the heart of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at exceptional price”
Reviews.Author: SimonCLiverpool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a few nights in July/August. The hotel's a 10 minute walk from the Plaza de Espana Metro station. It's an absolute bargain at around £50 per night. The room's a great size, it's clean, and the staff is friendly. If you're after a truly Spanish experience you may be disappointed since it's an 'international hotel', but apart from that, I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Affordable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kholiday
Reviews.Content: This hotel as commented by other travellers is very affordable. The location is perfect you can catch the metro from to Plaza De Espana and walk to the hotel which is great. Daniel at the front desk was very helpful and extremely good to deal with. The rooms are very large and the airconditioner works well. The only complaint is the bathrooms are small but really how much time do you spend in the bathroom? Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good price, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Nemtynakht
Reviews.Content: No complaints here. Room was extremely clean and very spacious. Kitchenette was a great touch. Location was amazing and easy to find. Wish they had wifi throughout the hotel, but the dedicated computer in the lobby was a nice touch. Breakfast charges are high - go to a convenience store and buy your own for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Plaza Espana”
Reviews.Author: WeeLuv2Travel2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a one way side street just off a road that turns into Gran Via. The rooms were very nice and breakfast was included since we booked online. The garage is just past the hotel entrance, we pulled off the road into the hotel "driveway" to check in then backed up onto the road to get to the garage. Had an odd experience the first morning when I poured orange juice into a glass I found on the shelf then one of the staff almost bumped into me. He turned then told me I had the wrong glass and promptly took it out of my hand and went into the kitchen!!! My only other complaint was that the internet connection wasn't very good. We always managed to get connected but local only, no Internet. The receptionist gave us different cables and a different room to try but without success. They then tried to say it was our computer which we challenged since we successfully connected in many many other hotels. Then one night around 9pm I switched on the computer to do some work offline and it connected to Wifi!!!!! We were connected for about an hour before losing the connection. I really suspect that bandwidth was the issue, but they market Internet access in every room. The hotel is within the hop-on hop-off bus route, so if you turn left out of the hotel, take the first left then cross the road at the end the bus stop is right there close to the bottom of the steps to Temple Debod. You should walk up to the temple, and visit it, then walk to the end of the park where you get a good view of part of the city. The hop on-off bus was a good way to get an overview of the city. Several restaurants in Gran Via area including TGIF :o)) Overall a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “The room was nice till the sewer backed up”
Reviews.Author: Whistle-while-U-walk
Reviews.Content: Our stay was colored by the sewer coming up in the bath when we ran the sink, even after letting the hotel know and them "fixing" it we still had problems. But we worked through them. Compensating this was the staff who were very healpful and the fact that we had a quiet room in walking distance of many attractions. 5 minutes from the palace, 15 minutes from Plaza Mayor, beautiful parks. Yes, we would stay there again but would check the plumbing before we unpacked.Good value. There are nearby cafes with good value for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great, quite location.”
Reviews.Author: BeezTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Suites Viena hotel is located in a nice residential neighborhood in Madrid that is far enough away from the city center but close enough to get there quickly. We stayed in a junior suite that was small, but nice. The bathroom is tiny! It is hard to get around in it, I am used to small bathrooms in Europe, but this was the smallest I have seen. The bed is also the firmest bed that I have ever slept on, all of the beds in Spain are firm, but this one was FIRM! The room had a really nice, private balcony/patio, with a table and lots of space, to sit out on with a drink in the evening. We had breakfast included in our room price, and it was a very nice buffet to have before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away, accessible, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sameoldg2
Reviews.Content: The Suites Viena Hotel is tucked away around the corner from Plaza de España, just a short walk to the Metro. Its a newer hotel with a clean design. I arrived an hour or so before check-in time, but the woman at the front desk, despite not being able to contact housekeeping, checked me in and gave me my key and told me to let her know if the room wasn't clean yet. It was, and I was able to drop my luggage and set about exploring Madrid. The room itself is somewhat bare. There's an electric range, sink, and a minibar refrigerator making up the "kitchen", which sits beside a closet containing the safe. Inside the room is a desk with two chairs, two chairs for seating, the bed, and a small TV on a stand. The floor is hardwood, which is a nice touch. Noise tended to be a problem at night. My room faced the street, and there's a big excavation project of some kind going on across from the hotel which commenced around 7AM. Noise also tends to travel within the hotel - neighboring rooms with children were quite loud from within my room. I heard another visitor complain to the front desk about noise as well. There is wired Internet in your room (you can give a 6€ deposit for an Ethernet cable, or bring your own) or Wifi in the lobby - ask the front desk for the password. Overall I found the Suites Viena quite satisfactory. The staff was friendly, the location, while not in close proximity to a lot of the action, is easily accessible, and everything was clean and in working order. Noise may be a problem for light sleepers on strange time schedules.

Reviews.Title: “A Cool Oasis in Hot Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgher01
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner spent four nights in the Hotel Suites Viena as part of a city break. We decided on the hotel - as part of a deal through Expedia - having read the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor, and we certainly weren't disappointed. The location of the hotel is great - central, in a very quiet street just to the north of Paza España, and a ten minute walk from the excellent tapas bars of Malaña district. The staff are extremely friendly and efficient, the hotel is decorated to a very high, if somewhat minimalist, standard, and the rooms extremely clean and comfortable. It may not be very green, but the air conditioning in the room was very welcome with daytime temperatures during our visit climbing to over 35 degrees celcius. The breakfast in the hotel looked very good, but we decided to go local and partake of the excellent breakfast in a very popular local cafe round the corner on Calle de Ventura Rodriguez (unfortunately I've lost their card, but look for a black fronted cafe with a an egg design on the sign!). We certainly would recommend the hotel to anyone planning on visiting Madrid, and will stay here again if we return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul_&_Sanderella
Reviews.Content: Attractive, trendy decoration in room, unfortunately the window did not shut completely and that caused noise from the street in the room, small bathroom, no sounds from the neighbouring guests, rather central location, good price, and fantastic reception by Anna(?)

Reviews.Title: “A Short Suite Stay”
Reviews.Author: zippymonkey
Reviews.Content: We chose Suites Viena for a two night break in Madrid, following many good reviews on here and also an excellent price available online. The hotel is on a quiet street, two minutes walk from Plaza Espana with its excellent metro links around the city. Alternatively it takes around 15 minutes to walk into the heart of Madrid. The hotel stands out on an otherwise dusty and tired street with a shiny, clean and modern facade; which is matched by the bright, clean interior and efficient, friendly staff. We arrived early and it was no problem to store our luggage until our room was ready. The rooms are large, with an especially wide, comfortable bed with long "sausage" shaped pillows. The bathroom is also large and well equipped, with complimentary toiletries including everything from toothpaste to shoe shine. There is also a small kitchenette, with microwave, two electric hobs, a sink and cupboards. The hotel has complimentary internet access on a computer in reception, and also a free wired broadband connection in every room (ask at reception for the cable). A breakfast buffet is served every morning from 7am - 11am, and although expensive at 12 Euros each, it is well worth it. There is a wide range of fresh, good quality ingredients (endless hams, cheeses, biscuits and cakes; churros; hot eggs and sausages; cereals and fresh fruits) with a choice of proper coffees fresh from a proper machine. Indeed, the breakfast was so good, we didn't need any lunch, so it proved to be quite an economical option! A good tip whilst staying here is to take a quick walk (less than 5 minutes) round the corner to the Templo de Debod, in the Parque Del Oeste. There is an amazing view of the Royal Palace and the Cathedral from the edge of the park. All in all, we would heartily recommend Suites Viena for anyone on a city break in Madrid - you would struggle to find anywhere else in the city that would combine a good location with such large rooms for such a small price.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel which has really thought about what travellers want”
Reviews.Author: HollyHall
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clean, unfussy lines so don't stay there if you like ornate decoration. Our room was very large for a capital city hotel and the bed was a large king size. There was free wifi and a PC and printer for use in the lobby. So it was really easy to check in online and print our boarding cards for the return flight home. If you were a business traveller it would be handy as there was a big uncluttered table in the bedroom which could be used for work. It was only 5 minutes walk to the metro and 10 minutes walk to the Plaza Oriente which has plenty of restaurants. The only negative would be if you were a single woman. The street was very quiet at night and the Plaza Espana is probably not a great place for a single woman to walk through at night. I would definitely stay there again if going to Madrid and not look at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, decent location... Really uncomfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: china_traveler07
Reviews.Content: Rooms are airy and spacious but basic (white walls and light colored furniture with no real color anywhere made the rooms feel a bit spartan). Located in Arguelles, hotel is not near most tourist attractions; however, it is an easy 5 minute walk from the hotel to the Plaza de Espana metro station, and I found all of Madrid's attractions to be easily accessible. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast served is good. My chief complaint - the bed was very hard and, in my opinion, very uncomfortable. It is hard to get a good night's sleep when you can feel the mattress springs...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, location, condition”
Reviews.Author: kampongboy
Reviews.Content: (1) Their staff is first class. Very knowledgeable, very enthusiastic about travel. Laura & Alex helped us a lot. Explained places, food, local people's way of life to us. Love them. Love them. Love them. (2) Hotel is new, clean, with nice contemporary deco. (3) Location is perfect. Quiet residential area. 5 minutes walk from Plaza España Metro station. Madrid is so, so, so well connected by Metro. You can easily cover the entire city with Metro + walking. Metro is €1 per trip! Cheap! Metro is super frequent. (4) From airport to hotel, you can use Metro (need to change train only once --- easy). Or, taxi is €26-29 from aiport. (5) I booked my travel via Travelocity. When I got there, they couldn't find my reservation --- they actually don't work with Travelocity! So, how on earth did Travelocity do that? I don't know. Luckily, they had room. They honored the prices (I brought along a printed reservation details). But they were fully booked the entire week after. Lucky us. (6) They breakfast is nice. I wished I included when I booked the hotel. We paid €11/person. The lady at the buffet is really, really nice. She helps to make cappuccino/latte, etc. I drink 3 cappuccinos every morning! Good life! (7) Value is good, our average was USD125/night for 3 nights. (8) Stay here --- it's a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice - would go back”
Reviews.Author: StephenBrowne
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel after deciding not to stay at the hotel we originally booked online. Because we booked this one online we got the full buffet breakfast for free (saving 96 euros) . Right from arriving the small but friendly and helpful team made every effort to accommodate our requests, letting us view a selection of rooms before picking one. The rooms are modern but sparsely appointed but do have a microwave, and cooking facilities should you wish to use them. Easily located 3 minutes from the Egyptian Temple, 7 minute walk from two metro stations, 15 minute walk from the Palace and 20 minutes from Mayor Square, this is a really easy location to see Madrid from. Just make sure you get a high room on the front - we even took a smoking room - we are non-smokers and the room did not smell of smoke - a tribute to the cleanliness of this hotel. Small, perfect, not high on onsite amenities, but well recommended. See Hotel Praga for where we would have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: boulderave
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to find a better hotel at such a reasonable price. The staff was terrific-friendly, capable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A spacious, modern, hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Kaihonu74
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was welcoming, especially Mathias (?). A great breakfast buffet, reasonably priced. Attentive help there. Very roomy room. The bathroom was cramped, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for such a clean and modern hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: mcnamn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at the Suites Viena. The rooms were spotlessly clean with wooden floors and no carpet. Lots of counter space in the modern bathroom and a microwave and stovetop in the room, although we didn't use them so not sure about utensils or plates as they weren't in the room. The Metro station is a five minute walk or you can take an extra 20 minutes and just walk to the city centre. The palace and some park space is close by, but the hotel is located off main streets so very quiet. There's no wireless in the room but the front desk will give you a wire to plug in so you can get online with your laptop. We didn't eat at the hotel for breakfast but the food sure did look good when we walked by. For travelers who don't speak Spanish - the staff were friendly and able to communicate in English. Considering the high quality of the rooms, the good location and the affordable price, we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Spacious, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: happyfeet54
Reviews.Content: Such a nice place to stay. The bathroom has ample counter space and was clean and bright. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Very quiet so no noise to keep you awake. 5 minute walk from the Plaza Espana metro. There are kitchenettes in the rooms and they have meeting and conference rooms for businesses. No wifi in the rooms, just a shared computer by reception.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Ana”
Reviews.Author: riario
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was the help we received from Ana, she worked at the front desk every morning we were there. Her English was very good and she helped us make various arrangements for our family (14 people) including hiring a minibus to transport everyone. The hotel is clean and very modern, it is a bit out of the way but still easy to reach on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent moderately priced & pleasant neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: miss_utility
Reviews.Content: We took the metro from the airport to the Plaza Espana with only one change. It's an easy 2 block walk with rolling luggage from the Plaza Espana metro station to the hotel. Our room overlooked a quiet side street that dead ends into the Plaza so not much traffic. The elementary school across the street reverberates with happy playing children at recess times, but that's fairly brief & easy to tolerate unless you like to sleep past 9AM. Ask for a room on the back side if you want quiet. Front desk check-in was quick & easy with the staff speaking fluent English. If you request when confirming your reservation cooking utensile will be in your kitchenette. Ours included a fry pan & expresso pot, dishes, cutlery, & the ever important corkscrew, can opener, etc. The frig was stocked as a mini-bar, but we could remove things to make space for our perishables. A gourmet grocery & deli with fresh fruit, cheeses, wine, bakery & take out dinners is about 4 blocks away in the ground level of the huge "El Cortez Ingles" department. store at C. de la Princessa.& Ventura Rodriguez. "Dia" a neighborhood grocery is a block away with cheaper prices. The hotel offers a substantial breakfast buffet for a fee, but we opted to cook breakfast since our jet-lagged bodies demanded food at odd hours. True, the bathroom is small.......but everything was in excellent condition and very clean. The kitchenette was also spotless. There's a safe for valuables. The minimalist decor that is so popular in Spain it a bit sparan for my taste........but the furnishings & linens were nicely coordinated and of good quality. The bed was hard for my taste...pillow-top mattresses don't seem to be the fashion in Spain where they believe in the "orthopedic" mattress. The bare Pergo floors were warmer than I expected in November. And the big window swings open for fresh air. The TV had only one English channel (BBC) but we got a kick out of watching favorite American cartoon characters speaking German or Spanish. Travel should be educational after all. The Palacio de la Real and Cathedral de la Almudena are about 3/4 mile walk from the hotel. All the sights of "old Madrid" in Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor are just a two metro stops away. We felt very safe walking everywhere in this primarily residential neighborhood. Our son was studying in Madrid, so we celebrated Thankgiving at "Cascaras" a tapas and wine bar a few blocks from the hotel. The only poultry on their menu was Pheasant Salad....so we indulged on our last night in Spain. We were so satisfied with the Hotel Suites Vienas for the first 4 nights or our trip that we returned for the final night of our trip before flying out of Madrid. I recommend this hotel to independent travelers who don't want a lot of personal service and like the option to collapse and "eat in" after a long day of sightseeing. Tip: Buy the 10 ride Metro pass. It can be shared by two people and you can get around the city like the Madrilenos without wasting your precious vacation time in traffic jams. Get a map of the city with the metro routes from the Tourist office in Barajas airport (next to the metro station) and you will be good to go. There's a 1 Euro surcharge to exit from the metro station into the airport......save a Euro coin to purchase that supplemental ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: PeterBeard
Reviews.Content: Good location, smart and modern, quite quiet, large room (but small bathroom), good (if pricey) breakfast, newspapers included the FT, reasonably priced minibar, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean”
Reviews.Author: SquirrelMinx
Reviews.Content: This apartment hotel is conveniently situated near Placa Espana, Opera and close to the metro. It is very clean and stylish and new. They offer free wifi but this didn't work when we stayed there. The breakfast was not included in our price and very expensive at 12Euro per person. The rooms are large and with a kitchenette. Unfortunately there were no utensils in the kitchen apart from two glasses. We would give it a 3.5, but as this doesn't exist in the grading system at TripAdvisor we have opted for a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ced82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The location was great, very near the Plaza de Espana and Parque del Oeste. The room was extremely spacious and modern. The bathroom was rather small but functional and clean. The only reason I do not rate this hotel as 'excellent' is for the lack of 'Spanish feel' and the fact that the hotel was slightly impersonal. However, I do believe this hotel is good value for money and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: parkyp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of the other Trip reviews. It was superb, clean, more than adaquate accomodation just off the Gran Via so very quiet. Rooms were wonderful for single travelers, very large,light and well lit. Bathrooms only had a half bath but shower over bath was more than adaquate. Large towels were replenished as required and cooking implements were provided if asked for the kitchenette area - I'm not sure why they could not be left for every guest as there were plenty of cupboards. Free fridge and safety deposit box and superb breakfast to set you up for the day. My room was extremely quiet but my friend had a room that faced onto the road and was disturbed by the dutcart doing the rounds at 3a.m.- ask for a room facing the back of the building. Most of the guests were Spanish and on business. The position was very good for walking to restaurants around the Plaza Orient - we tried to stay away form the Gran Via! I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rca215
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Suites Viena for 3 nights of Easter weekend, and had a great experience. The room was large by urban standards and immaculately clean with nice furniture, bathroom and other amenities. Free internet is available - they'll give you a cable for your laptop or you can use the computer in the lobby. Breakfast was included, even though we did not choose it when booking, and it was pretty good (not worth paying for though, in my opinion). The location was convenient, right by the Plaza de Espana (with metro connection to airport, with 1 transfer), and nearby the historic part of town and the Gran Via shopping area. We walked almost everywhere we went. The only downside was that most of the restaurants/bars in the immediate neighborhood were closed for the holiday weekend, but it wasn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Suites Viena”
Reviews.Author: no818528
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites Viena for 2 nights in March. I found the the hotel to be very clean and the staff were very accommodating. The hotel is located on a side street and buses / coaches cannot get close enough to load / unload. It is somewhat modern and therefore has minimum carpets. This is realy a plus for cleanliness reasons but sometimes makes the hotel a little louder than usual. The breakfast was sufficient but could have been a little warmer. I have stayed in many hotels in Madrid and would recommend this hotel as a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: vandenhaak
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the good reviews here, the location and the price. We weren't disapointed. We had the metro from the airport which was only 2 euro for one person. We had the plaza espana station and from there is was about 3-5 minutes walk to the hotel. The staff was very friendly. When we checked in we became a map of Madrid and very willing to guide us on the map to all the major and minor sites of Madrid. The room is small but everything you need is available and spotless clean and you have a kitchen. The flat screen TV has 10 channels in espanol, but who cares! You are in Madrid! The location is very good just of the centre, wich can be very hectic, in a very quit and safe neighbourhood. Just 5 minutes walk to the royal palace and plaza oriente. The plaza del sol for about 15 minutes walk. The Prado museum will take you about 35 minutes walk and when you are lazy take the metro. Have breakfast in the cafe Viena on the corner for a cup of coffee, huge pastry or there breakfast specials for about 3 euros. If you want a drink before dinner go to Viga Mar's it is in the same street and you will pass it if you go to the plaza espana. Only 1 euro for a small beer or glass of wine and you get some tapas too! in this little bar were locals meet. We enjoyed our stay here very much and was perfect for us. Next time we come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and peace”
Reviews.Author: LindaRH
Reviews.Content: Suites Viena was the perfect base for a trip to Madrid. I can only assume that the 3-star status is due to the fact that it's a limited service hotel (i.e. there's no bar, restaurant etc.) as the quality and comfort of the surroundings definitely deserve a higher rating. Also, the quiet location a minutes walk from the Plaza de Espana was ideal as it gave quick access to the centre of Madrid while also providing an escape from the crowds. There are a number of bars, restaurants and grocery shops nearby so you won't go hungry - for the less adventurous, there's also a Starbucks and some well-known fast food outlets a couple of blocks away! I spent a little extra and booked one of the junior suites (room 603) with terrace, and I feel it was worth the money. The room itself was very spacious and the furnishings comfortable; although the huge bed was indeed two smaller (yet full-size) beds put together, the 'join' could barely be felt. The terrace was a great bonus, providing a private space to enjoy the last of the days warmth while relaxing before heading out for the evening. As a previous reviewer mentioned you can't really do much with the small kitchen area, but having the fridge was useful (it includes some mini-bar items) and I'm sure the microwave would come in handy for some. There's also a room service facility in the form of a menu from a local restaurant - they deliver direct to your room, and the pizza is lovely! The hotel provides breakfast too; its quite basic but enough to keep you going til lunch. Having said that, as I'd booked through the hotels own website it was included in the rate; I wouldn't have paid the 12 Euros for it otherwise. The hotel is also close to good transport links - bus and metro - that make it easy to get around lovely Madrid when your feet can't take any more. The 'Madrid Vision' tour bus has a stop just a block away too. As for getting to the hotel a taxi from the airport cost 25 Euros, which seemed reasonable given the volume of traffic and the time it took, while on the way home I decided to try the AeroCity shuttle service at 20 Euros - I was picked up exactly on time, and the poor driver performed a minor miracle in managing to pick up the next clients AND get us all to the airport on time, given we got caught up in some kind of demonstration in the Puerta del Sol! Madrid is an amazing place on all sorts of levels and I know I'll be going back soon. While I appreciate that limited service hotels won't be to everyone's taste, and although it's far removed from some of the spectacular 'traditional' hotels in the city, I can't imagine finding a more convenient and comfortable place from which to enjoy Madrid than Suites Viena.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, modern & new, great balcony!”
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at Sercotel Suites Viena in Madrid. Unfortunately the wheather was terrible, the city was flooded and our spacious balcony / terrace ( 4 chairs+ table, 20 square meters) remained just a reminder that the Madrid has good wheather too... We paid an extra 20 euro's per night to upgrade to a suite since they didn't offer regular rooms with a balcony. The suite is a good size with plenty of storage space. The bathroom is small (1 basin, bath and wc) but clean. A kitchenette in the sitting area with a small fridge/freezer, microwave and 2 burners. You will need assistance from the receptionist to get kitchen utensils (a pot to boil water for tea f.i.) and to switch on the main plug for the kitchen appliances. You'll be able to make breakfast and nescafé, but with just 1 pan, don't expect to do much cooking. The staff is helpful and friendly. They provided umbrellas (much needed) and wheather reports (bad news). The airconditioning/heating, the laminate floor, the blackout curtains, the good-sized bed and comfortable modern furniture made our stay a very comfortable one (despite the endless rainstorms). I would recommend this hotel to anyone for any purpose: business (good desk and free wifi), family (kitchenette= ideal with children, quiet and safe location) or citybreak (near royal palace and bike rental next door).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: grafran
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in a quiet street, close to Plaza de Espana & Ventura Rodriguez metro stations. The staff are very friendly and helpful, with excellent service from housekeeping. We did not take breakfast in the hotel but used the Cafe Viena (same owners), just up the road. The room was good, except for the design of the shower area, which really needs something to stop the water going all over the floor! Although you can ask for crockery, cutlery, etc., which was brought quickly and willingly, the kitchen area is not really very suitable for self-catering. If you want to make coffee, suggest you bring your own coffee jug and kettle!
